texts.en: Barbra is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She has one additional family member (an orphan).  She sells second hand clothes at the market. She sells her product on a retail basis .She has been in this business for the last two years. She works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT - SACCO to buy more bales of second hand clothes.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of used clothes.  She aspires to become a wholesaler and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara sells sandals and slippers in Krofoforao, near Abura. Clara has received an education through junior high school.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher. Clara has been selling sandals and slippers for two years now. She is responsible for paying school fees. Her loan will be used to buy sandals and slippers in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sandals and slippers in bulk.

loans.name: Manobanda Tiñe

texts.es:
ANGEL  TIENE 28 AÑOS ES SOLTERO VIVE CON LOS PADRES NO TIENE HIJOS.

SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, TRIGO Y CEBADA EN TERRENOS ARRENDADOS EL DINERO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIR EN ABONOS Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS, EL DINERO LE AYUDADO A SUPLIR LAS NECESIDADES. 

EL SUEÑO DE ANGEL ES COMPRAR MAS TERRENOS PARA SEGUIR PRODUCCIENDO PARA TENER DINERO PARA EL FUTURO.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A PASAR CON LOS PADRES
texts.en: Ángel, 28, is single living with his parents; he has no children.  He works growing corn, wheat and barley on leased land.  He needs the money to buy manure and fertilizer for his crops.  The money has helped him meet his needs.   Ángel’s dream is to buy more land to continue producing to have money for the future.  He likes to spend his spare time going out on walks with his parents.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
ROSA TIENE 44 AÑOS SOLTERA TIENE CUATRO CUATROS HIJOS VIVE EN CHIMBO.

SE DEDIDA AL COMERCIO MINOSTRISTA DE MOTE EL DINERO LO SOLICITA PARA LA COMPRA DE MOTE PARA SEGUIR VENDIENDO, EL CREDITO LE AYUDADO A CRECER EN EL NEGOCXIO.

EL SUEÑO ES INCREMENTAR EL NEGOCIO PARA DAR A LOS HIJOS.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA PASAR CON LOS HIJOS.
texts.en: Rosa, 44, is single and has four children; she lives in Chimbo.  She works as a hominy retailer.  She’s requesting the money to buy hominy and continue selling it.  The loan has helped her grow in business very much.  Her dream is to increase business to give her children.  She likes to spend her free time with her children.

loans.use: to buy hominy.

loans.name: Teresa Gisella

texts.es: Teresa tiene 55 años de edad y vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, hace 5 años no había panaderías por su sector así que decidió ubicar su negocio en casa. Actualmente tiene una panadería acondicionada donde vende leches, yogurt, colas, tortas y panes ya que esta es su especialidad. Empieza sus actividades desde las 5 de la mañana que es cuando se levanta a preparar los panes, una vez que están listos empieza la venta hasta las 5 de la tarde, sigue esta rutina todos los días. Una de sus mayores preocupaciones es que no pueda elaborar el pan. Con el préstamo que está solicitando Teresa comprar harina, mantequilla y un horno adicional para aumentar su producción. A futuro espera ampliar la panadería combinando el negocio con bazar.
texts.en: Teresa, 55, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil.  For 5 years, there had not been a bakery in her neighborhood, so she decided to set up a business in her house.  Now she has a bakery set up where she sells milk, yogurt, colas, and the cakes and breads that are her specialty.  She starts working at 5 in the morning when she gets up to prepare the bread.  Once the bread is ready she starts to sell, and she sells until 5pm.  She follows this routine every day.  One of her main worries is to be in a situation where she can't make the bread.  With the loan that she is requesting, Teresa will buy flour, butter and an extra oven so that she can increase her production.  In the future, she hopes to expand her bakery, combining that business with a general store.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and an oven

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Ms. Kaneez is a married woman and has 2 children. She provides an education for her children. Around six years ago, when she got married, she faced many financial crises, her family was very poor and her husband was a laborer. She decided to start a business of milk selling. At that time she had only one buffalo. 

Initially, Mrs Kaneez faced many difficulties in managing her business affairs with her household activities. But with the passage of time, she now manages  both activities efficiently. Now she has 3 buffalo for milk selling and more than 5 goats for selling. She wants to take loan of PKR 40,000 for buying calves for the future growth of her business.

Ms. Kaneeza has a motive to provide basic necessities for her children and to provide financial support to her husband and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, who received schooling through junior high school, is the married mother of two children. Her husband is an electrician, and she is responsible for paying school fees.

Cecilia has been selling cooked rice in Krofoforao, near Abura, for ten years and will buy raw rice in bulk with this loan. She hopes to use the resulting new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw rice in bulk

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells gari and maize in Krofoforao, near Abura. Ekua has received no formal education.  She is divorced and has two children Ekua has been selling gari and maize for 12 years now. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy gari and maize in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy gari and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is 29 years old. He makes and sells wood carvings and woven baskets in Malindi town. He has been in this business for the last three years, with a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer and he is applying for his second loan in the amount of KES 60,000. He intends to buy additional stocks of raw material for his business. 

Bonface will save the anticipated profits and invest them back into his business. In the future, he hopes to continue growing his business and also venture into other investments.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of raw material for his business

loans.name: Mtengo

texts.en:
Mtengo is 27 years old, married, and the father of two children. For the last year, he has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from his stall. He earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. He is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional stock such as onions, tomatoes, mangoes, pineapples, and cabbages for resale.  

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family good and stable financial support.

loans.use: to buy additional onions, tomatoes, mangoes, pineapples, and cabbages

loans.name: Jessica Vanessa

texts.es: Jessica es una madre soltera trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa, toldos, sabanas recorriendo sectores de Libertad, Ancón y Santa Elena. Ella realiza todo el trabajo, vendiendo, promocionando y entregando la mercadería. De momento no tiene ninguna dificultad en su trabajo ya que tiene varios años de experiencia, conoce a sus clientes y los sectores donde realiza sus recorridos. Con el préstamo que está solicitando va a comprar mercadería para tener en stock. Espera a futuro incrementar su negocio y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jessica is a hard-working single mother who sells clothing, crib canopies and sheets, by going around neighborhoods in Libertad, Ancón and Santa Elena. She does all parts of the job: selling, promoting, and delivering the merchandise. 

At the moment, she has no difficulties in her work, as she has several years of experience, and knows her customers and the areas where she makes her rounds. 

With the loan she is applying for, she is going to buy merchandise to have in stock. She hopes to increase her business in the future, and this way give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing, crib canopies and sheets.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monica is a 22 year old married woman. She has 2 children, aged 1 year and 4 years. She describes herself to be very jovial and a cheerful woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a busy town near a bus stop and her primary customers are passengers and residents. 

Monica describes her biggest business challenge to be the varying changes of preferences of her customers during cold and hot weather changes. These changes make it difficult to choose a meal that won't go to waste if customers fail to purchase. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to start a new business of a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that she will be able to educate her children in the future and to buy land for her family.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 31 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be cheerful and social  man. He operates a bicycle, providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located within an estate and his primary customers are residents within the estates. 

Paul describes his biggest business challenge to be low customer demand for the bicycle services. Customers have a preference for motorcycle transportation as they fear falling from the bicycle. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a motorbike so as to attract customers for his transportation services. His business goal is to buy another motorcycle within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a house and start a new business of poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 27 years old, married and a mother of two children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling fruits such as mangoes and coconuts in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

Kadzo was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 to buy additional stock of fruits to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as to expand her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue with her business with the possibility of owning a well stocked food kiosk in the area so as to improve her financial status.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits.

loans.name: Union Y Amor 1 Group

texts.en:
Yris is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor Branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is the coordinator for the group called Union y Amor (Union and Love) 1. She has been running a grocery store for seven years, which she started with her first loan from Esperanza. She will invest this loan in her grocery store. She will buy products like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and many other goods.

Yris lives with a child and her long term partner in their simple structure home. She says that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business, and provide a good education for her child. She enjoys working in her business. She is very excited to be receiving her 11th loan from Esperanza Internacional. She plans to save the profits for future plans. One of the goals is to rebuild her house with a better and safer structure. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flour, canned food, vegetables and others.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 49 years old, married and the father of four children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his retail shop. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

James was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officers, and he is applying for his third loan of KES 80,000, to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil and food stuff such as flour to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil and food stuff such as flour.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 30-year-old single man. He describes himself to be an organized man. He operates a retail business where he sells snacks. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within an area which is densely populated and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent disturbance from local authorities with a need of selling standardized snacks. He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more snacks to resell. His business goal is to run a similar business in his home town within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to buy a pool table. Simon also runs a pool table game entertainment business and a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy snacks to resell

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a resident of Getafe, Bohol. She relies on her food vending business to earn an income. She cooks homemade snack food like rice cake and pancake. This is her way to help her husband who works in a government office.

She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar and seasoning. Once her ingredients are available, she can focus on increasing her production. Her income will provide her family with a healthy diet and savings. 

In the future, Adela plans to make her business bigger and expand her menu to attract more customers for a better income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar and seasoning

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Felipe tiene 65 años de edad  y vive en su propia casa con su familia.
El señor Felipe tiene una despensa en su domicilio que es atendida por el mismo, en su despensa se venden panificados, refrescos, productos de limpieza y comestibles.Gracias a esta actividad,  el y su familia han salido adelante, y puede mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
Con el crédito desea extender su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
Felipe is 65 years old, and lives in his own house with his family. 

Felipe has a grocery store in his home which he runs himself. His store sells baked goods, soft drinks, cleaning products and foodstuffs. 

Thanks to this business, he and his family have moved forward in life, and can support their household and pay for any unforeseen expense. 

With the loan, he wishes to expand his business in order to satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, baked goods, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny  de 32 años  vive en la ciudad de Bogotá;  ella como propietaria de una microempresa que elabora y vende productos sanitarios para mascotas, especialmente para gatos y perros. Desde el año 2010 inició su experiencia en este proceso y solo hasta el 2011 hizo funcionar su negocio, no muy usual peo con un importante potencial de crecimiento; por eso atrajo su atención, porque su competencia es muy poca. Los dueños de mascotas son sus principales clientes y  le compran usalmente pues ella hace un trabajo de mucha calidad. Jenny trabaja sola en su proceso hace rascadores, camas, colchonetas, arena sanitaria, para gatos;sus negociaciones las realiza telefonicamente o por internet; En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará   a un mayor volumen y de contado, insumos para la cotización de artículos que permiten el aseo de los perros  y de los gatos; el éxito de esta inversión es que cuenta con una clientela fija y un enorme potencial de crecimiento, porque es un negocio con muy poca competencia. Su meta mas adelante es exportar sus productos sanitarios y mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograr mas rapídamente su crecimiento y esto es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos como bentonita sodica en mayor volumen entre otros materiales,  para lograr tener un stock que aumente sus ventas mediante el impacto de su promoción.
texts.en:
Jenny, 32, lives in the city of Bogotá.  She is the owner of a micro firm that manufactures and sells pet potties, especially for cats and dogs.  She started the business in 2010 and the business started to take off in 2011.  It’s not a very common business but it has great growth potential which is what drew her attention to it; competition is scarce.  Her main customers are pet owners and they buy from her regularly because she does high quality work.

Jenny works alone and her process includes making scratchers, beds, bed pads and kitty litter.  She does her negotiating either by phone or via Internet.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy larger amounts of supplies for cash so that she can get better prices for items used in cat and dog grooming.  

Her investment will succeed because she has a regular clientele, enormous growth potential and because her business has very little competition.  Her goal for later on is to export her sanitary products and her greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to quickly attain growth which is precisely the reason for the Kiva loan request, the first financing she’s had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy supplies, like sodium bentonite in larger amounts, among others to have sufficient stock available so that sales will increase as a result of the impact of her advertising.

loans.use: to buy  supplies in larger amounts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Five Traders Group

texts.en:
Mamusu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mamusu was born in Mankneh village in Northern Sierra Leone about 27 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has 2 children attending school. For many years now, Mamusu has been selling fresh fish. 

This is the second loan that Mamusu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. The first loan made a lot of improvements in their lives and businesses. Having finished repaying that loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones each to further expand on their respective businesses. Mamusu is going to use her share of this loan to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current ones

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved wood masks and sculptures. He hopes to be able to purchase materials for his workshop including sese wood and additional tools.

Eric has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I learned carving at a local shop for three years and later established myself with my own shop. I started carving as a full time profession in the year 1997 at the age of twenty-three, and I now have one boy that works with me. We are four children in my family, among which my junior brother and sister are also talented with the skill of carving. My brother helps me a lot at the shop."

"I am so grateful to the people who are supporting my work with this microcredit. Thanks to you, I'll be able to invite other artisans to assist me and to buy the materials we need to keep working."

Use the link below to view Eric's masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=1974

loans.use: to purchase materials for his workshop including sese wood and additional tools

loans.name: Cicelia

texts.en:
Cicelia, 30 years old, is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has three children ages 6, 8 and 9. She has been engaged in the hog raising and transportation business for 9 years now.  The business is the source of her daily income for her family. 

As of this time, she is requesting a loan to buy a new engine and spare parts for her tricycle. She will be able to augment her income if her business is doing well. Cicelia hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable in the future. Any additional income will be used for her children's education and for the family's daily expenses. In the future, she hopes to have another tricycle that will continue to generate income for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a Peruvian artisan who crafts traditional Andean musical instruments such as flutes, panpipes, guitars, maracas and drums. He would like to purchase the materials he needs, such as wood and bamboo, to increase production. Dionisio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. 

This is his story:
"When I was eight years old, I began to learn this craft from my father. I started making instruments just for fun. I make most traditional Peruvian musical instruments, including percussion such as bombo and tinya drums, stringed instruments such as charango guitars, and wind instruments like the quena panpipe and zampoña flute. I use wood and bamboo and colorful cotton threads to give each instrument a traditional Cuzco style. Thanks to hard work and my great customers, my children are able to get a higher education. Three of them want to follow their own career, while the other three want to help me."

"Thank you so much for your help. I'm just getting out of a difficult economic situation and this micro-credit seems like a gift from heaven! With it, I hope to be able to continue crafting instruments and increase sales. Many thanks from your friend, Dionisio."

Use the link below to view Dionisio's handmade instruments on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=103

loans.use: to purchase the materials he needs to increase production, such as wood and bamboo.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a Sari-sari store owner from Loon, Bohol, Philippines. She is 42 years old, married and has 7 children. Her eldest child is 20 and her youngest is 8 years old. 

Elsa is asking for a loan worth 13000 PHP to buy more items to sell like canned goods, seasonings and noodles. With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and profit from the business. Elsa knows that this will also boost their source of livelihood and allow her to help her husband, who works as a driver. 

In the future, Elsa dreams of expanding her business to generate more income so that she can support the schooling fees of her children. Any additional income will be for savings.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, seasonings and noodles.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 24 year old married man. He has a son who is 2 years old. He describes himself to be a visionary and a friendly man. He operates a retail store, where he sells items such as salt, sugar, flour, bread, sodas, water, eggs, snacks etc . He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a viable business environment with many potential customers and his primary customers are local residents. 

Felix describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items to resell to his customers, so as to meet their demands. His business goal is to expand his business to a shopping mall within 5 years. He hopes to run two supermarkets in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy household items for reselling.

loans.name: Elvije

texts.en:
Elvije is an Egyptian single mother from one of the two vulnerable ethnic minority communities of central Albania. She has ten children in total, ranging in age from sixteen to twenty-seven years old and none of them is attending any schools, even though two of them are school-age children. 

Elvije sells used clothes and shoes. She has been doing this for almost ten years and, with the earnings, she has been able to raise her children. Now she feels that she has to improve her living conditions by increasing the sales in order to generate more profit. This is the reason that she is now requesting a Kiva loan in hope that lenders would show their understanding in this matter.

Elvije has been referred to VisionFund Albania from the institution’s existing clients who have commented on her responsible character trait.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes and shoes

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina and her husband, Manuel, are Mexican artisans who craft decorative wall mirrors with tin repousse and Mexico's traditional Talavera tiles. They would like to stock up on materials such as tin and tile so that they can increase production.

Macrina and Manuel have been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is their story:

"We've been close to arts and crafts all of our lives, and in fact they are what brought us together. Our technique is traditional handcrafting, but our current designs include decorative items like mirrors, ceiling panels, candleholders and colonial style lamps. Our inspiration is born in each new style as we create from our ideas for people to enjoy. Our designs are crafted by hand with excellent quality and the unique touch of Mexican handiwork. With each item, we show you our love of life."

"We appreciate your trust and support in this microcredit with all our hearts. We had wanted to show our designs to the world for such a long time and, thanks to you, we are achieving our goals. Many, many thanks!"

Use the link below to view Macrina and Manuel's traditional crafts on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8072

loans.use: to stock up on materials such as tin and tile so that they can increase production.

loans.name: Orquidia Isabel

texts.es: Orquidia empezó su bazar hace varios años a raíz de que tuvo a sus hijos y decidió poner algún negocio que le ayude con los gastos de su casa. El negocio lo abre todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 22 de la tarde haciendo un receso en la tarde para ir a comprar sus productos. Una de sus dificultades es la ubicación donde se encuentra su negocio ya que el sector es un poco peligroso. Su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa y sus hijos son todos mayores de edad y están casados. Con el crédito que está solicitando comprara, peluches, perfumes, papelería, etc., mejorando así sus ventas para cancelar puntualmente las cuotas esperando tener una buena relación con el banco y a futuro poder realizar otro préstamo.
texts.en: Orquidia opened her store a few years ago after she had her children, and decided to start a business to be able to help with the household expenses. Her business hours are from 7am to 10pm, 7 days a week, closing in the afternoon for a bit to be able to buy her products. One of the challenges she faces is the location of her business, because the area is a little dangerous. Her husband works as a driver for a company and her children are all adults and are married. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy stuffed animals, perfumes and paper products, etc. This will allow her to improve her sales and be able to make her payments on time, with the hopes that she will maintain a good relationship with the community bank and be able to take out another loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stuffed animals, perfumes and paper supplies.

loans.name: David Israel

texts.es: David a sus 24 años es todo un hombre de negocios, comenzó a vender ropa que adquiere en Guayaquil ya que los costos son más bajos y luego vende en Libertad. Vendía jean, camisas, interiores, pantalonetas, buzos actualmente crea logotipos para camisetas. El trabajo lo realiza de lunes a sábado todo el día ya que no tiene ayudantes y como es soltero no tiene preocupaciones. Por el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente ya que no ha sufrido mayores percances. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de una maquina, camisas y buzos para la venta. A futuro desea tener sus propias maquinas ya que para tener los logotipos debe crear un marco y solo se lo puede usar una vez.
texts.en:
David, at 24 years of age, is a businessman. He began selling clothes that he acquires in Guayaquil, since the costs are lower there, and then sells them in Libertad. He was selling jeans, shirts, underwear, shorts, and sweatshirts and currently he is creating logos for T-shirts. He works all day from Monday to Saturday because he has no helper, however since he is single, he does not have any responsibilities. At the moment he has not had any problems since he has not suffered major mishaps. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy a logo machine, shirts and sweatshirts to sell. In the future he wants to have his own machines since in order to have logos, you need to create a brand and it can only be used once.

loans.use: to buy a logo machine, shirts and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Abigail Silvia

texts.es: Abigail tiene en las Orquídeas un taller de modas, comenzó desde muy joven ya que vivía junto a una tía que es modista y fue ella quien le enseño la costura. Luego de eso ingreso en varios cursos con los cuales aprendió las técnicas. Por el momento ella realiza solo el trabajo y cuando tiene mucho trabajo contrata a una persona por horas para que le ayude. Ella está realizando el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y una máquina de coser con la cual aumentaría la confección de blusas, camisas, pantalones, short. A futuro espera tener un atelier con varias maquinas industriales y operarias para lograr aplicar a contratos con grandes y así mejorar la económica en su hogar brindándole a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Abigail has a fashion shop in Las Orquideas. She began when she was very young since she lived next to an aunt who is a fashion designer and it was she who taught Abigail to sew. Afterwards she took several courses where she learned technique. At the moment she runs her shop alone, however when she has a lot of work she hires someone by the hour so they can help her.

She is taking out a loan to buy fabric, thread and a sewing machine, with which she will expand her production of blouses, shirts, pants and shorts. In the future she hopes to have a studio with several industrial machines and operators so she can apply for contracts from major companies and thus improve finances in her household and provide her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es: Silvia empezó la crianza de pollos hace varios años, al principio tenía pocos animalitos por lo que se ayudaba en su economía pelando camarón en una empresa empacadora. En el cuidado y alimentación le ayuda su mamá ya que estos animales son frágiles y se mueren sin la atención adecuada. Gracias al apoyo del banco ha podido hacer crecer su negocio ya que en la actualidad compra pollo y cerdo para su crianza y venta, la venta la realiza cada quince días en la plaza de su ciudad. De momento no ha tenido ningún problema o inconveniente con el negocio por lo que a decidió hacer un nuevo crédito con la fe de que aumentaran sus ventas y podrá cubrir los pagos sin problema alguno. Su meta a futuro es poner otro negocio que siga la línea de los animales para tener más ingresos ya que es madre soltera y desea darle el mejor estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Silvia began raising chickens many years ago. At first she had very few animals, so she helped her economic situation by peeling shrimp in a packaging company. She helps her mother through raising and feeding the animals, since the animals are fragile and can die without proper care.

Thanks to the support of the bank, Silvia's business has been able to grow and she currently purchases chickens and pigs for raising and selling. She sells every 15 days in her city's plaza.

Since she has not had any problems or inconveniences with the business, Silvia has decided to request a new loan in the hopes of increasing her sales and paying her bills without any problems. Her goal for the future is to start another business raising animals in order to have a greater income, since she is a single mother and wants to provide the best education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Brima S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has applied for a loan of 7,650,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and repayments on their behalf.

Pictured in the right is Brima, the leader of this group of borrowers. A native of Magburaka town, Brima is 55 years old. He is married to a housewife and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending primary school. Brima has been a professional teacher for 36 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like cement and iron corrugated zinc for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement and  iron corrugated zinc for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Makeni city about 38 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending primary schools. 

Kadiatu sells mints, biscuits, lollipops, sugar, salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,400,000) to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy mints, biscuits, lollipops, sugar, salt, Maggi, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Checuan

texts.en:
Checuan is a Mexican artisan who works in ceramics and stoneware, and with this microcredit, he hopes to purchase materials such as clay, minerals, and glazes.

Checuan has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I'm from the state of Guanajuato, and I recall being attracted to ceramics from a very young age. By the time I was 16, I started going to my godfather's workshop. I would just go there to visit and admire his work, but I had no intention of earning a livelihood from it. Eventually, my first assignment was at the potter's wheel, and during those first three years I became enamored with the work as I learned more and more with each passing day. Thinking about my future when I was 19, I decided that one day I would like to set up my own workshop. I now feel I have established myself in the world of ceramics and see it as my duty to teach others who hope to one day have their own ceramic workshop like me. Being associated with Novica means a lot to us. It makes us feel proud to know that people from every corner of the world will appreciate our work. I am thankful to the Lord, as well as to those who graced me with their teachings and confidence."

"I appreciate the opportunity for growth through this microcredit. You are feeding our creativity so that we can continue to bring our ideas to life in ceramics. You are also making it possible for us to buy natural materials and take responsibility for our impact on the environment. Thank you for your support."

Use the link below to view Checuan's ceramics on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7739

loans.use: To purchase materials such as clay, minerals, and glazes

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo en casa familiar tiene una hija de dos años de edad, administra una granja y venta de pollos, su madre le heredó este negocio hace dos años cuando falleció, ella trabaja todos los días atendiendo las necesidades de la granja.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de 200 pollos, también la compra de concentrado, esto le permitirá mantener un buen nivel en la granja, que le ayude a mejorar la capacidad para atender la demanda.

Su objetivo es a futuro poder mejorar las instalaciones de la granja, ampliandolas del tamaño actual, ya que tendrá un mayor número de pollos por lo que necesitará más espacio.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband in the family home. She has a two-year-old daughter. She runs a poultry farm and sells chickens. She inherited the business from her mother, when she passed away two years ago, and works everyday, attending to needs on the farm.

Ana is applying for a loan to purchase 200 chickens and also feed. This will enable her to keep her farm in good shape and help her improve capacity so she can meet demand.

Her objective is to be able to improve the installations on the farm in the future by expanding the current size since she will have a larger number of chickens and thus will need more space.

loans.use: to purchase 200 chickens and feed.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from five to seven years.

He describes himself to be an optimistic man. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs two staff members. His business is located within a busy estate and his primary customers are residents from the estates. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a pumping machine for water to sell to customers. His business goal is to buy several tanks from a nearby town within five years. Wilson plans to expand his garage business in the future. Previously, he was involved in a charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine.

loans.name: Women In Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Women In Unity” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fudia. Fudia is age 50; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and six children. Her husband is a trader and one of her children is in college and the rest are no longer attending schools. 

Fudia sells firewood and has been doing this kind of business for many years now. With this loan, she is going to buy piles of firewood to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy piles of firewood to add to her current stock.

loans.name: We All Na One Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “We All Na One” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 3,900,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Emma is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old is married to a businessman, and they have 5 children: 3 in primary school, and 2 in secondary school. Emma has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells palm oil (the country's most popular cooking oil). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Tokuru-Omarsu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tokuru-Omarsu” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mabinty is the leader of this group. The 48-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children - one in primary school and two in secondary school. Mabinty has been a businesswoman for more than 20 years now. Currently, she is selling gara-lappers (locally dyed cloth). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy gara-lapper making materials like inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of gara-lappers to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy gara-lapper (locally dyed materials) making materials like inks, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro 1, 3 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of the group Hoyo del Toro, named in honor of their community. This is a small community on the road to San Pedro de Macoris and this group has 15 businesswomen. Carmen is a young mother of three children.

Carmen sells clothes, especially second-hand clothes, in a flea market close to her community. When the Esperanza program went to her community, she decided to have a loan for her business. Now, after amost 11 loans, she has been able to establish her business and to provide for her family. She will invest this loan to buy a bag of used clothes and  she will also purchase new clothes.

Carmen said that her biggest challenge is to raise her children in a better environment; she wants to give them a safer life, and with as few needs as possible; she is working to provide school, food, clothes and other needs. She enjoys learning and taking care of her children. She dreams of seeing her children attend the university, graduate and become professionals. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a weaver who specializes in hand-woven Zapotec rugs and handbags. He would like to expand and improve his workshop and invite other weavers to collaborate with him. He also plans to stock up on materials, such as wool.

Mario has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I come from a family of weavers in Mexico. It is a legacy I inherited from my great-grandfather. Nowadays, my designs are different from those of my great-grandfather, but my aim is to preserve and promote the beauty of the Zapotec art. We dye the wool with natural colorants such as cochineal, walnut tree bark, and local flowers. We work on pedal looms, a process that can take anywhere between one day and a whole month, depending on the size and design."

"I want to thank you for making it possible for us to preserve the art of Zapotec weaving and share our designs with the world."

Use the link below to view Mario's rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4567

loans.use: To expand and improve his workshop and invite other weavers to collaborate with him

loans.name: Nelson Santiago

texts.es: Nelson vive en Libertad donde tiene una tienda de venta de víveres, escogió esta actividad debido a que no conseguía empleo, empezó con un pequeño capital que le fue dado al momento de recibir la liquidación en su empleo. Con este empuje inicio su negocio comprando solo snacks, colas, confetis, arroz, granos, enlatados y poco a poco fue aumentando sus productos a medida que los clientes le solicitaban. Se siente satisfecho ya que gracias a esto a esto ha podido cubrir sus gastos y los de su familia. Nelson actualmente está separado pero tiene 2 niños a los cuales le ayuda económicamente razón por la que desea aumentar su inventario y por lo que va a solicitar el crédito. A futuro su meta es ampliar su local.
texts.en: Nelson lives in Libertad where he has a grocery store.  He chose this activity because he could not get a job.  He started with a small amount of capital that was given to him as a severance when his job ended.  With this small sum he started his business, buying only snacks, soft drinks, sweets, rice, grains, and canned goods.  He gradually increased his products according to the demand of his customers.  He feels satisfied that thanks to this business, he has been able to cover the expenses for himself and his family.  Now Nelson is separated, but he has 2 children that he must help financially.  This is the reason why he is requesting a loan to increase his inventory.  His goal for the future is to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, sweets, rice, grains and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 55 years old, but in spite of her age, she is good at direct-selling products from Personal Collection. She is married with four children. Three of them are adults and the youngest is 13 years old. She is working hard for her family so she can provide for their needs.

There has been a business boom in Cirila's community of Loon, Bohol recently.  Cirila is asking for a loan to buy Personal Collection products like powder detergent, cleaning agents, lotion, and body talc. This is her way to help her husband who works in the construction business. In the future, Cirila would like to improve her business to include products from other companies to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy Personal Collection products like powder detergent, cleaning agents, lotion, and body talc

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group "Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo (Christ and our effort) 3". This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and luxury tourism. 

Maritza makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business.

Maritza is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products. She will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women´s accessories, and other products to resell. 

She will use the profits to improve her quality of life. Maritza and her group thank you for your help in achieving their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women´s accessories) to resell.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has two children aged 3 and 7. In 2000, Mohamed established his patent drugs business. The business started out of the need to be self-sustainable and care for the needs of the family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,270,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy additional patent drugs. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 520,700. In the future, Mohamed plans to improve the business to a pharmacy. The loan can improve the stock and increase the profit.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for patent drugs

loans.name: Star Group

texts.en:
Star group is formed by 3 women who have been together for 4 years. They sell cooking utensils, cutlery sets, vegetables and tilapia fish. They started taking loans from ID-Ghana in 2010 and have been consistent and loyal. They meet every Wednesday to discuss business issues.

Joyce is a 43-year-old vegetable seller who is married to a 45-year-old butcher. She has 5 children who are schooling. She helps her husband financially to cater for their children. She took 200 Ghana cedis as her 1st loan and 700 Ghana cedis on her 3rd loan. She repaid all loans without default and now she needs 1000 Ghana cedis to buy more onions, tomatoes, cabbages, carrots and garden eggs (small eggplants). She sometimes helps her husband to sell in the market. Her monthly profit is 120 Ghana cedis which she uses part for reinvestment and part to help her husband.

The group members need a total amount of 2100 Ghana cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more onions, tomatoes, cabbages, carrots and garden eggs (small eggplants) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposa, los tres hijos están estudiando y tienen el apoyo de él, su oficio es la agricultura sembrando maíz y también la crianza de ganado, trabaja al mismo tiempo como empleado brindando el servicio de vigilancia, en los momentos libres es que realiza sus trabajos y tiene 18 años de experiencia realizando ambas labores.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, también invertirá en mariscos que es la venta que realiza su esposa, comprando pescado, langostas, camarones, este préstamo le permitera la ayuda con los recursos económicos, poder solventar las necesidades del negocio, comprándose lo necesario para seguir trabajando.

El objetivo de él es mejorar los cultivos, tener más terrenos donde poder realizarlos y aumentar la producción, también poder mejorar su ganado comprandose un mayor número.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and three children who are attending school with his support. He is a farmer, planting corn and raising livestock, and also works as a security guard. His free time is spent working, and he has 18 years of experience at both professions. 

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and weed killer. He also will buy seafood, which his wife sells, such as fish, prawns, and shrimp. This loan will help him financially, allowing him to cover business expenses and buy necessary supplies to keep working. His objective is to improve his plantings, acquire more farmland, increase production, and buy more livestock to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, and seafood..

loans.name: Lifted Up Group

texts.en:
"Lifted Up Group" is made up of 3 women in the central part of the town. They are into fish mongering and provisions, and they meet on Friday to discuss business issues. This is their 5th loan cycle with ID-Ghana and they have repaid all loans without default. One woman is married with children and two women are not married.

Joyce is 51 years old and not married. She works hard to progress from one loan cycle to the other. She has been growing tremendously in the sale of fish because fish is a consumable item and thereby is in demand high. She was given 500 Ghana cedis in her 4th loan cycle and completed the cycle on 03/08/2012. She now needs 700 Ghana cedis to be able to buy more fish to sell to customers.

The women in this group need a total of 1650 Ghana cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa specializes in cotton accessories and apparel for men and women. She would like to expand production by adding more local weavers to her workshop, and she would like to purchase additional raw materials and supplies, including combs for the looms, leather, and threads. Luisa has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story: "My story is really the story of my whole family, beginning with my parents. My father was passionate about growing cotton, a crop that originated with the Mayans. We work with only three pure colors. Apart from the crude cotton color, we use a seed known as ixcaco that produces brown cotton. We call our third color jade. All the rest of our colors are a result of combining fibers and threads from these three when weaving the fabric. I am thankful to be considered for this micro-loan, because it means I'll be able to offer work to women weavers from about 30 communities."

Use the link below to view Luisa's cotton accessories and apparel on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7298

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies and to expand production by hiring additional local weavers for her workshop

loans.name: Sensius

texts.en:
Sensius is a 45-year-old man; he is married to Dorce, a 34-year-old lady. They have four children: Maxen,19, graduated from senior high school; Imelda, 15, attending 3rd grade of junior high school; Apsari, 11, attending the 5th grade of elementary school; and Apriska, 6, attending kindergarten.  Sensius owns a kiosk business selling household items such as detergent, bath soap, shampoo, biscuits, sugar, snacks, cigarettes, etc. He initiated the business in 2004, using his own capital. The business is really important for Sensius as it enables him to cover his family’s living expenses. 

The increase in market price and demand for more stock from the customers led Sensius to seek more money to buy various items. He got information from his neighbor about TLM and then submitted a loan application and requested a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000. Sensius plans to spend the loan on a refrigerator, mobile phone recharges, cigarettes and snacks.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, mobile phone recharges, cigarettes and snacks.

loans.name: Yerni

texts.en:
Yerni is a 37-year-old woman who is married to Samuel, 45 years old. They are blessed with five children: Marni, 21, attending University; Rini, 16, attending senior high school, grade 2; Yana, 14, attending junior high school grade 2; Putri, 9 and Dedi, 6 attending elementary school grades 4 and 1. 

Yerni operates a fried cake stall – selling fried bananas, fried tofu, soybeans, and donuts near her house. The reason why Yerni runs the business is because her husband’s income is insufficient to fully support their family. 

Yerni would like to improve her business income by distributing cassava and banana chips at kiosks around her village. She also needs money to pay her daughter’s university expenses. Therefore, she requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. She would like to use the loan to buy cassava, bananas and cooking oil to improve her business as well as to pay her daughter’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy cassava, bananas and cooking oil to improve her business as well as to pay her daughter’s school fees.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 62 years old and has 3 children.  Crisanta is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Crisanta has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. Nilda is married and has a vegetable business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable products. Nilda has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Nilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 38 years old and lives in Pulot, Ozamiz City. She is married with three school-age children.

She operates a store where she sells secondhand and recycled goods. She typically earns approximately 4,000 PHP every month. She explains that she has been running this business for almost five years.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional recycled materials for her business. Lorna hopes to become successful through her business operations and to expand her business in the neighboring towns of Ozamiz City.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional recycled materials

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is a villager from a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Thorn is a 33-year-old, married mother of four children. She has three daughters and one son, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school.

The main source of her family's income is from rice-farming, though her husband supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. They have been in these businesses for almost ten years. Their current businesses allow them to earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day and to save approximately 4,000 KHR per day for their future needs. Drought is the main challenge for her rice-farming business.

Thorn has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and proudly explains that she repaid the previous loans. The other team member has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. The previous loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan with VisionFund. Thorn will use her portion of the loan proceeds to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay fees for a water pump so that her rice plants can be harvested. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more and better rice than before, which will in turn enable her to generate more income, improve her family's standard of living, and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to pay for water for her rice-farming business

loans.name: 06.03.07 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair services.

Hà is the group leader of the 07 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses, T-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Letecia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses, T-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en:
Nilfa is married  and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Nilfa is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.  She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Nilfa requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her business.

Nilfa has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nilfa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 52 years old and married.  She has seven children, two of whom are in school. Phoebe works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Phoebe has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Phoebe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fredilyn

texts.en:
Fredilyn works hard to support her family. Fredilyn is married and has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish business. She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Fredilyn would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her dried fish business

loans.name: Ever Erasmo

texts.es: Ever tiene en su ciudad natal Libertad una venta de ropa la cual empezó de manera ambulante hace varios años. Escogió esta actividad debido a las pocas oportunidades que se le presentaron para conseguir empleo y fue gracias a sus ventas que logro adquirir un local en el mercado municipal por lo que ya no necesita hacer recorridos. La atención la realiza solo y cuando hay feriado contrata a un ayudante pagando sus servicios por hora. En su local oferta blusas, camisas, camisetas, jeans, calentadores ya que es lo que más solicitan sus clientes. Una de sus mayores preocupaciones es la delincuencia ya que a veces hay mucha gente y se aglomeran lo que llena el local y pierde visión, es en ese momento que los ladrones aprovechan para robar. Espera obtener el crédito ya que desea comprar mas mercadería para la venta esperando a futuro crecer hasta conseguir abrir una sucursal en otra ciudad.
texts.en:
Ever sells clothing in his birthplace Libertad. He began as a street vendor several years ago. He chose this work because there were few opportunities for employment. With his sales, he managed to acquire a stall in the city market, so he no longer has to make rounds. He usually works by himself, but he hires an assistant at an hourly wage when there is a fair. At his stall, he sells blouses, shirts, t-shirts, jeans, and warmups because they are the items his customers request most often.

One of his greatest worries is crime. Sometimes, a lot of people gather in the stall, and he can't see well. Thieves take that opportunity to steal. He hopes to obtain this loan since he wishes to buy more merchandise to sell and to grow his business and even open a stall in another city.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, t-shirts, jeans, and warmups.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.en:
Saly is a 56-year-old woman living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children.

She is a teacher, but she supplements her family’s income through farming rice on four hectares of farmland. She explains that he has been in the farming business for 33 years and that her farming operations earn her approximately 20,000 KHR per day so that she can pay her family’s living expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her rice-farming business.

Saly has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and proudly states that she successfully repaid her prior loans with VisionFund. The other member of her group is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. The prior loans have helped Saly relieve her family’s daily burdens and improve their livelihood. Now she and her fellow group member are requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 KHR each. As the team leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan proceeds to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for gasoline for her water pump. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more and better rice, which would in turn allow her to generate more income and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to operate her water pump for her rice-farming business

loans.name: Caminemos Al Futuro  Ii Group

texts.es:
La socia Luisa tiene 54 años y es divorciada pero tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la hermosa provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de socia Luisa es la brindar servicios turísticos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia Luisa tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes en sociedad con sus hijos  En esta oportunidad Luisa requiere el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos. Su sueño de la socia es abrir una ferretería. (Las socia  Luisa está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Caminemos al Futuro II” en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; ferretería y agencia de viajes y otros se dedican a la venta de chocolates y comida, venta de zapatos y algunos brindan servicio de internet. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego tarde a la reunión del banco comunal). 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Luisa is 54 years old and divorced, but she has three children. Currently, she lives in the beautiful province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. Luisa’s business offers tourist services. She has worked at this business for some years already and it’s going very well for her. Luisa has a small travel agency in partnership with her children. At this time, Luisa needs a loan to buy tourist tickets. Her dream is to open a hardware store. (Luisa is lifting her hand in the photo).

This group is composed of neighbors and friends who formed the communal bank Caminemos al Futuro II (Let’s Walk to the Future II) in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. This communal bank is made up of people who, at every moment, are looking for opportunities to get ahead, and with their daily strength, to give a better future to their children. The members’ business activities are, for example, hardware store and travel agency; others work selling chocolate, food and shoes, and some provide Internet services. 

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity they have been afforded, and they are dedicated to paying off their different loan installments within the time period. (The person in the lower part of the photo arrived late to the communal bank meeting). 

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the department of Cusco, in the heart of the old Inca city. It is known for its tourist area, its archeological center, historical center, its scenery, and for being an enchanting city in the country’s Southern Region. Cusco is also known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for having one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase tourist tickets.

loans.name: Palmira Yngerborg

texts.es: Actualmente, la señora Palmira tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene un hijo, ella sigue con la ocupación de la venta de productos de belleza a diferentes personas como vecinos, amigos y familiares. Ella ofrece sus productos de una empresa o marca conocida mediantes catálogos, pero se especializa en venta de perfumes, colonias, aretes para caballeros y damas. Palmira en esta oportunidad esta pidiendo el préstamo para capitalizar su negocio y desea comprar la mercadería como perfumes, aretes pues sus clientes que desean. La señora Palmira se ha comprometido a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo. La socia Palmira es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Minibank”.
texts.en:
At present, Palmira is 32-years-old, married and has a son.  She continues in her occupation selling beauty products to different people like neighbors, friends and family members.  She sells her well-known brand products via catalogue but she specializes in the sale of perfume, cologne and earrings for men and women.  

On this occasion, Palmira is asking for a loan to capitalize her business.  She wants to buy merchandise like perfume and earrings because that’s what her customers want.

Palmira has committed to make all the loan payments on time.

Palmira is an enterprising, responsible, woman who continues belonging to the “Minibank” communal bank.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Jose Wilian

texts.es:
Jose, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para aumentar el capital de trabajo en su negocio su objetivo es comprarse más  pan en variedad de presentaciones, adquiriendo un gran número de este producto para continuar atendiendo a los clientes de diferentes zonas.

Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le mejoró la calidad, ya que antes vendía en una bicicleta y ahora realiza en una motocicleta, le da mayor capacidad para distribuir, también una mayor cantidad de pan, considera que está mejorando y continúa con su sueño de comprarse un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Jose has decided to take out a new loan to increase his work capital. In his business, his goal is to buy more bread in various forms, acquiring a lot of this product in order to keep serving customers in different areas.

He says that the previous loan improved the quality, since before he sold on a bicycle and how he does it on a motorcycle. It gives him greater distribution capacity, and also more bread. He believes it is improving and he is still after his dream of buying a vehicle for the business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of breads

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
El socio Fidel sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. Fidel tiene 59 años, está casado y tiene un hijo, él sigue trabajando como taxista en la ciudad de Cusco. Fidel trabaja la conducción diaria en toda la ciudad y que realmente disfruta de su trabajo, él está pidiendo un préstamo a fin de mejorar su taxi osea va hacer mantenimiento del motor, él está muy orgulloso de su coche y este préstamo le ayudará a seguir cuidandolo mucho.

El socio Fidel se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Fidel is still a member of the “Minibank” communal bank.  He’s from the city of Cusco.  He’s 59-years-old, married and has a son.  He continues working as a taxi driver in the city of Cusco.  Fidel works driving throughout the city every day and really enjoys his work.  He’s asking for a loan to improve his taxi.  He’s very proud of his vehicle and this loan will make it possible for him to continue caring for it very much.  Fidel is grateful for the opportunity being provided by this means and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on the motor

loans.name: Fernando Richard

texts.es: El socio Fernando tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mi Perú” de la Asociación Arariwa, él es natural de la ciudad de Arequipa y desde hace nueve años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco, él es un padre responsable que se dedica a la elaboración de productos naturales a base de cereales como por ejemplo maíz, cebada, habas, maní, pasas, etc. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad el socio Fernando requiere el préstamo para comprar bolsas y etiquetas para embasar sus productos naturales. El socio Fernando se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: The group member Fernando is 54 years old, he is married, and from that union he has two children. He belongs to the communal bank "Mi Perú" or "My Peru" of the Arariwa Association.  He is a native of the city of Arequipa and for the past nine years has lived in the city of Cusco.  He is a responsible father who works making natural products from grains like for example corn, barley, beans, peanuts, raisins, etc.  He has been working in this field for 8 years and it is going well.  At this time Fernando needs a loan in order to buy bags and tags in order to package his natural products.  Fernando finds himself grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and also promises to comply with the payments corresponding to his loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy bags and tags for packaging natural products made from grains like corn, barley, beans, peanuts, raisins, etc.

loans.name: Yuris Mabel

texts.es:
Yuris, se ha decidido por un nuevo prestamo,pues considera necesario la inversión en el negocio de un mayor número de productos, como lo son gaseosas, refrescos, gatorade, para continuar ofreciendo a los clientes, esta nueva inversión le permitirá estabilizarse.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mantener el negocio estable, ofreciendo a los clientes productos de calidad, atendiendo su demanda, ofreciendo también frutas de temporada, su objetivo es mantener en el negocio todos aquellos productos que puedan generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Yuris has decided to request this new loan because she believes it is necessary to invest in the business with a greater number of products. This increased product variety includes soft drinks, sodas, and gatorade. She will continue to offer her products to customers and the new loan will help her to stabilize the business.

With the previous loan, Yuris was able to maintain stability in the business. She offers quality products to the customers, attends to product demand, and also offers seasonal fruit. Her goal is to maintain in the business all of the products that can generate income.

loans.use: to purchase drinks: soft drinks, soda, and gatorade.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 31 years old and is a carpenter in Mombasa. He is married and a father of two children. He has done carpentry for the last three years and he is doing great. 

This is his fourth business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase new hummers, nails, timber, and chisels. 

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes to gradually expand his business and be able to support his family with ease.

loans.use: to purchase new hammers, nails, timber, and chisels for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. For the past 7 years, Norma has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Norma has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 4 years, Irene has operated a business providing motorela or motorcycle services, with her husband as the driver. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for maintenance. Irene has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. She earns additional income from selling charcoal and raising pigs. Alma is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 8 years, Analiza has operated a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Analiza has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell. In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for the past 15 years. She earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Ana Dalinda

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de ropa y también a la venta de medicamentos es una mujer de hogar, buscando siempre las alternativas para poder crear una condición económica estable con su familia.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de blusas y faldas, ropa interior, que son de uso femenino también se comprará productos de belleza como lociones, cremas, al mismo tiempo invertida en medicina natural como la linaza, vitaminas, esto le dará una mejor solvencia para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Su objetivo es mantener surtido el negocio para poder abastecer la clientela, a través de estos préstamos espera mantener los niveles de venta.
texts.en:
Ana sells clothing and also medicines.  She is a domestic woman, always looking for alternatives to create a stable economic condition for her family.

Ana is requesting a loan to purchase blouses and skirts, underwear.  She will also buy beauty products for women such as lotions and creams.  At the same time she will invest in natural medicine such as flaxseed and vitamins.  This will give her better solvency to meet customer demand.

Ana's goal is to keep the business stocked to be able to cater to customers.  Through these loans, she hopes to maintain sales levels.

loans.use: to purchase blouses and skirts, lingerie, lotions, creams, and natural medicine.

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
Conrada is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.
