For the past 5 years, Conrada has operated a business making and selling viand (tasty dishes) such as adobo (marinated and cooked meat or seafood) and kare-kare (oxtail stew in a peanut-based sauce). She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients such as fresh vegetables, spices and meat used to make viand.

Conrada is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make viand

loans.name: Hon's Group

texts.en:
Hon is a 59-year-old man living in a rural area of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. He has eight children. One daughter is still dependent on him and helps with the family’s business.

He has made a living through rice farming on four hectares of farmland, though he supplements the family’s income by planting sesame, corn and beans on two hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for ten years, he is able to earn approximately 17,000 KHR per day and manages to save approximately 10,000 KHR per day for future needs. However, drought is the main challenge for his field business.

Hon’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. He is leading his group to apply for their first micro-loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As the leader of the group, he plans on using his portion of the loan proceeds to protect his rice plants by buying fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for gasoline. He hopes that the loan will allow him to generate more income from his current business so that he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To protect his rice crop by purchasing fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for gasoline

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Batbaatar, 59 years old, lives with his daughter in a little house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His daughter Batbileg, 19 years old, is a college student in Ulaanbaatar.  Batbaatar operated an organic milk and dairy products retail business from 2003 to 2010. His business was sustainable and had  many regular customers and suppliers. Until 2012, he worked for a local company and, in May 2012, he started to operate a clothing sales business. Since Batbaatar does not have a stall to sell his products, he uses his car. He needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more goods to improve his new business. Batbaatar is a hardworking and hilarious man who says, ''My daughter is a college student. So I have to prepare for her tuition.''

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to improve his new business

loans.name: Sokhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn, 49 years old, is married and has four children. To support the family, she has been working as a rice farmer and her husband is a soldier. They have been in the rice faming business for almost thirty years and currently earn about KHR 20,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sokhoeurn’s group consists of five female members all living in the same village of the Kandal Stoeng district's Kandal province. Sokhoeurn is in her fourteenth loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to better support her family. Sokhoeurn will use her portion of this loan to buy materials such as a latrine pan, sewage and tile drains, etc. for constructing a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine to get healthy and to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy materials for constructing a decent latrine

loans.name: Franklin Isaac

texts.es:
Franklin, vive con sus padres, también con su esposa y tres hijos, se dedica a atender un taller de reparación de vehículos, este taller lo tiene instalado en un lote que alquila frente a su vivienda, el realiza su trabajo en este lugar y también de forma ambulante, lo hace desde hace ocho años.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cargadores de batería, taladros para mover de llantas de los vehículos, llaves y desarmadores, estas herramientas son muy necesarias para el buen funcionamiento del taller y le ayudará a él para continuar realizando un buen trabajo a sus clientes.

Su aspiración es a futuro y a través de su trabajo, poder mejorar la vivienda donde reside con su familia apoyar siempre sus hijos para que éstos puedan prosperar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Franklin lives with his parents, his wife and his three children.  He has a vehicle repair shop.  It is located in a rented lot across from his home.  He works out of his shop and also travels around to work.  He has been doing this work for eight years. 

Franklin is requesting a loan in order to purchase battery chargers, hand drills for removing tires from their vehicles, keys and screwdrivers.  These tools are necessary for Franklin to do a good job and will help him to continue providing quality workmanship for his customers. 

Franklin's hope is that in the future, and through his work, he will be able to make improvements to his family's home.  He also wants to support his children so they can do well in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase battery chargers and hand drills to remove tires.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su madre, no tiene hijos, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol,  esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, lo aprendió a través de su padre, trabaja todos los días en atender el cultivo y en otros quehaceres.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, que son necesarios para el cultivo, ya que se aplican para prevenir las plagas y poder mejorar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, este préstamo le proporcionara los recursos económicos para solventar el gasto.
Su objetivo es mantener su trabajo agrícola, ayudando a su madre con los ingresos que pueda generar del trabajo, cubriendo todos los gastos alimenticios.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his mother; he has no children.  He works growing corn and beans, an activity he’s been in for the last 10 years.  He learned from his father and works every day caring for his crops and doing other chores.

He’s asking for a loan to buy manure and herbicide needed for his crops because they are applied to prevent infestations and to improve the corn and bean crops.  This loan will provide him with the economic resources to cover the expense.  His goal is to stay in agriculture supporting his mother with the income he can generate from his work covering food costs.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Jandire Katerine

texts.es:
La señora Jandire, es socia del banco comunal “Las Románticas “Distrito Coronal Portillo, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija.
Desde hace años viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de tubos y lo hace directamente con las constructoras, su esposo es administrador de una empresa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 100 tubos de una pulgada, 100 tubos de media pulgada, 100 uniones, 100 codos.
Su negocio es uno de los más rentable, se está iniciando como empresaria y espera tener  un mayor capital para poder tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de poder iniciar su negocio y sobre todo continuar con él.
texts.en:
Jandire is a member of the ‘Las Románticas’ (The Romantic Ones) communal bank in Coronel Portillo District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 24-years-old, married and has a daughter.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for years.  She sells pipes directly to construction companies; her husband manages a firm.

She will use her 2,000 new sol loan from Manuela Ramos to buy 100 1” pipes, 100 ½-inch pipes, 100 connectors and 100 elbow joints.

Her business is one of the most profitable.  She’s starting out as a businesswoman and hopes to have more capital in order to have more products to offer her customers.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity of starting her business and above all to continue with it.

loans.use: to buy pipes and bulding supplies.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester, 60 years old, is married and has 4 children. For the past 35 years, she has earned a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Ester also earns additional income from farming coconut and selling the dried coconut. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her cows. Ester is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her cows

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ariunbold, 26, is an electronic engineer who works in an Internet provider company. He has been doing this work since last year and has gained experience in his career.

Ariunbold lives with his family in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His apartment building was built in the socialist era and has not been completely maintained or renovated for many years. In winter, it becomes cold inside and has heat loss through its walls, windows and doors. Ariunbold usually uses a wood or coal-fired stove to heat the rooms, but it emits a toxic smoke in the air. Therefore, Ariunbold has decided to repair his bad apartment by adding wall insulation for more warmth and replacing the windows and floor. He hopes that his family can live in a warmer and more comfortable home after the repairs. This loan will be used to cover the cost of the building materials for the repairs.

loans.use: To make repairs to his old apartment.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda, es socia del banco comunal “Santa Rosa De Lima”, Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos menores
Tiene varios años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, cuenta con máquinas con las cuales trabaja y le son de gran ayuda  para coser sus prendas las cuales las exhibe para la venta y de esa manera  generar el ingreso para el hogar.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprara: 10 kilos de tela algodón, 10 kilos de tela viscosa, 5 metros de polares, 1 cono de elástico, 6 conos de hilos para remalle.
Por las mañanas se dedica a las labores del hogar y por las tardes se dedica a su trabajo más aún si tiene pedidos se queda trabajando hasta muy tarde.
Agrade a Manuela Ramos por todas los préstamos que hasta el momento ha recibido y que los viene pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Amanda’s a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” (Saint Rose of Lima) communal bank in Yarinacocha Department, Ucayali Department.  She’s 47-years-old, married and has five minor children.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos for several years.  She owns machines she works with that are a great help to her to sew her garments that she displays for sale and generate income for her home.

She will use her 2500 new sol loan to buy 10 kilos of cotton fabric, 10 kilos of polyester, 5 meters of fleece, 1 cone of elastic and six cones of mending thread.

She spends morning doing her household chores and the afternoons at her work even more so if she has orders to fill and then stays working until 
quite late.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for all the loans she’s gotten to date that she’s repaid punctually.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Chamroen's Group

texts.en:
Chamroen is a resident living in a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. He is a 40 year-old married father of two dependent children, one daughter and one son. To make a living, Chamroen has been involved in raising pigs and earns additional income by selling grocery items. He has been in this business for twenty five years. He is able to earn approximately KHR20,000 per day, but he can manage to save about KHR12,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Chamroen’s group consists of three members who live in the same village and he is the first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now he and his group members are applying for a loan, with VisionFund, of KHR1,000,000 each. As the group leader, Chamroen is going to use his portion to buy pig feeds for his pig raising business. He will use another portion of the loan to buy a pumping machine. He hopes this loan will enable his pigs to become fat and healthy and he also hopes to make more income so as to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds for his pig business.

loans.name: Carmen Irianda

texts.es:
Carmen Irianda tiene 35 años. De estado civil actual separada vive con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Carmen Irianda  se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas, urea, ranger y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. El sueño es tener una finca. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir con los hijos a pescar.
texts.en:
Carmen Irianda is 35 years old.  She is separated and lives with the children in the Ventanas canton of the Los Rios province.  She has 4 children.

The group V.R.C. El La Union is located in the Aguas Frias area belonging to the Ventanas canton.   This solidarity group is dedicated to short term farming, they grow corn, rice and beans.  They have been in this activity for a long time.

Carmen Irianda makes a living farming, growing corn, rice and beans.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells her production at the market in Ventanas and in the same precinct.

She is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies, urea and fertilizers for her crops.  The support from the loan will help her meet her financial needs.  She will be able to face the challenges of pests and diseases and weather changes.  Her dream is to own a ranch.  She likes to go fishing with her children in her free time.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies, urea and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Yeny Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Yeny, es socia del banco comunal “Santa Rosa De Lima”. Distrito De Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos menores de edad
Son cinco años que viene integrando este banco comunal y tiene  taller de  mecánica, negocia que lo tiene con su esposo es el profesional que brinda servicio en el taller, su negocio funciona en su casa en la parte de adelante y justo están en una avenida muy concurrida.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprara: una caja de bujías, una  caja de empaquetadura, una docena de cámaras, media docena de intermitentes, una docena de focos.
Trabajan todo el día en su taller para que a sus hijos no les falte nada, solo quieren seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos y poder surtir más su negocio con cada préstamo que hacen sigue incrementando más productos para tener que ofrecer al cliente.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por haberle dado la oportunidad a ella y su familia de poder mejorar la calidad de sus vidas.
texts.en:
Yeny’s a member of the “Santa Rosa De Lima” (Saint Rose of Lima) communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 34-year-old, married and has three minor children.

She’s been in this communal bank for five years now.  She owns an auto repair shop with her husband who is the professional that provides the shop services.  The business operates in the front part of their house and they are located on an avenue with lots of traffic.

She will use the 1300 new sol loan to buy a box of spark plugs, a box of seals, a dozen inner tubes, half-dozen turn signals and a dozen light bulbs.  They work in their shop all day so that their children can have everything they need.  

They want to continue working with Manuela Ramos and better stock their business with each loan they get thus increasing the supply of products available for customers.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her and her family the opportunity of improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia, es socia del banco comunal “Santa Rosa De Lima”. Distrito yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, solo dos están a su cargo.
  Es poco el tiempo que lleva como integrante de este banco comunal y está dedicada a todo lo que es la costura de prendas de vestir y lencería, que todo lo hace por pedido para no tener mercadería guardada y poder hacer trabajar la inversión.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 6 metros de tela para blusa, 5 kilos te tela de algodón llano, 5 kilos de tela algodón estampada, 5 kilos de viscosa para blusas.
Con este material tiene para poder trabajar y poder pagar sus cuotas a Manuela Ramos sin ningún problema, pese a que está mal de salud está trabajando para poder apoyar de alguna manera a su esposo que es docente en una escuela, da gracias a la persona que le invito a integrar este banco comunal donde se siente muy bien y espera seguir trabajando muchos  años mas.
texts.en:
Ofelia’s a member of the “Santa Rosa De Lima” (Saint Rose of Lima) communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s married and has four children but just two are still in her care.  She’s been a member of this communal bank for just a short time and she works sewing articles of clothing and lingerie.  Everything she does is on order so that she has no merchandise left over and she can make good use of her investment.

She will use the 1,000 new sol loan to buy six meters of fabric for blouses, 5 kilos of plain cotton fabric, 5 kilos of printed cotton fabric and five kilos of polyester for blouses.  With these materials she’ll have what she needs to work and to make her payments to Manuela Ramos problem-free. Despite her poor state of health, she works to help out her husband who works as a teacher at a school.  She thanks the person who invited her to join this communal bank where she feels very good and in which hopes to continue working for many more years.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, aged 30, lives in the village of Moung Russey, district of Battambang province and she has two dependent children who are all still in school. She has been involved in farming rice on five hectares of farmland and her husband supplements the family income by working as a paid construction worker. Having been in this business for almost ten years, they are able to earn about KHR30,000 per day and manage to save about KHR24,000 each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for the paddy rice business. 

Sinat has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles while the other group member is just in the first cycle with VisionFund. Sinat completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her to improve her standard of living. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR1,200,000 and KHR1,000,000, respectively. As the leader, Sinat is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and another portion of it to spend for labor costs and gasoline used for pumping water. She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to make better living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried coconut meat retail business in the Philippines.

Marites has requested a PHP 15,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy more stocks of dried coconut meat to sell. Marites has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Raylen

texts.en:
Raylen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business. Raylen has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Raylen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 27,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Rosa has been in this business for 40 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening and farming rice.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ivania Orbelina

texts.es:
Ivania, vive con su esposo y un hijo de dos años, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, este negocio surgió como una alternativa para generar ingresos, ha ido creciendo poco a poco a través de la experiencia que tiene de dos años, su horario de atención es éste las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio comprándose gas propano, carnes, boquitas, cereales, detergentes, este préstamo le ayudará a poder mejorar la disponibilidad y el negocio; así crecer en sus ganancias.

Su aspiración es tener a futuro casa propia, trabajar con dinero que le produzca el mismo negocio de que se le permitirá mejorar su ganancia.
texts.en:
Ivania lives with her husband and two year old son.  She manages a convenience store that sells basic necessities.  This business has emerged as an alternative to generate revenue.  It has grown slowly through the experience of two years.  Ivania's hours are from 5:30 am in the morning until 7:00 pm at night.

Ivania is requesting a loan to invest in the business by buying propane, meats, snacks, cereals, and detergents.  This loan will help to improve her availability and the business, and thus increase her profits.

Ivania's aspiration is to have her own home in the future, and to work with money for her business so that she can improve her profit.

loans.use: to buy propane, meats, snacks, and cereals.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, es socia del banco comunal “Santa Rosa De Lima”. Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 48años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, solo dos a su cargo, una de sus hijas ya está casada.
Lleva tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica  a la venta de bebidas heladas, su negocio lo tiene instalada en su misma casa y sus hijas le ayudan.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprara: 15 cajas de cerveza, 3 cajas de gaseosa.
No es mucho el capital que tiene para poder invertir por eso es que poco la inversión que hace, pero le alcanza para seguir trabajando.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir integrando este banco comunal que le dio acogida en su momento y que  no piensa defraudar a ninguna socia.
texts.en:
Rosa’s a member of the “Santa Rosa De Lima” (Saint Rose of Lima) communal bank in Yarinacocha Department, Ucayali Department.  She’s 48-years-old, married and has three children but only two are still in her care; one of her daughters is already married.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  She sells cold beverages.  Her business is installed at home and her daughters help her with it.  

She will use her 1,500 new sol loan to buy 15 cases of beer and 3 cases of soft-drinks.  She doesn’t have much capital to invest so her investment is small but it’s enough for her to continue working.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to continue being part of this communal bank which welcomed her; she does not intend to disappoint any of the members.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and beer.

loans.name: Humberto Elias

texts.es: Humberto tiene un local en su barrio donde vende todo tipo de calzado, inicio esta actividad porque desde muy joven trabajo con un amigo en un local en la bahía. Con el tiempo fue reuniendo dinero hasta llegar a un capital con el cual pudo abrir su propio negocio de calzado. De momento no tiene ayudante ya que el mismo realiza la atención y venta al público, el precio varía según la calidad y modelo del zapato también depende si es para niños y niñas. Se siente muy satisfecho por todo lo que él ha logrado en el poco tiempo que tiene su negocio. Hace poco tiempo hizo arreglos en su local aumentando perchas por lo que realizo el préstamo para la comprar de mercaderías y aumentar las ventas. A futuro le gustaría poder aplicar en la compra de un negocio municipal y abrir otro local en el mercado.
texts.en: Humberto has a store in his neighborhood where he sells all types of shoes.  He started this business because since he was very young he worked with his friend at a store at the bay.  In time he saved money until he had enough capital to open his own shoe store.  He currently does not have any help, he himself sells and takes care of the customers.  The prices vary depending on the type and quality of shoe and whether they are for boys or girls.  He is very happy with all that he has achieved in the short time that he has been in business.  Recently he has made improvements to the store increasing shelf space.  He needs the loan to purchase merchandise to be able to increase his sales. In the future he would like to be able buy a municipal business and open another store in the market.

loans.use: purchase merchandise, shoes and sneakers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señorita Margarita, es socia del banco comunal “Santa Rosa De Lima”. Distrito yarinacocha, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Lleva casi tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones (cuenta con 14 habitaciones).
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 balde de pintura, 6 planchas de triplay, 1 kilo de cavos, un ciento de tablillas, 10 metros de malla.
A su corta edad cuenta con  negocio propio que le generan ingresos mensuales, son diez cuartos que están ocupados, con estos ingresos puede ayudar a su mama con los gastos dela casa y también le sirven para que se de algunos gustitos, agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle todo los préstamos que solicita y que los sabe invertir.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” (Saint Rose of Lima) communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 21-years-old, single and has no children.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for almost three years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles.  Her business is renting out rooms (she has 14 rooms).

She will use her 1,000 new sol loan to buy 1 bucket of paint, six sheets of plywood, 1 kilo of nails, 100 pieces of lath and 10 meters of wire mesh.

At her young age she has a business of her own that generates monthly income.  Ten rooms are occupied.  She’s able to help her mother with household expenses with this income and she can also satisfy some of her own desires.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for granting all the loans she requests and that she knows how to invest.

loans.use: to buy paint and building supplies.

loans.name: Eidio

texts.es:
Eidio tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en el Pueblo Joven San Martín, en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el departamento de Lambayeque.
Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina utilizada en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). El lleva 1 año trabajando en esta actividad, tiene como principales clientes a los comerciantes de su zona. Adicionalmente percibe ingresos por trabajar en camales (proveedores de carnes de los mercados). Su esposa lo apoya en los gastos del hogar trabajando como jornalera.
Eidio desea comprar animales para venta, asi como su alimento y arreglar sus corrales, ya que por la experiencia que cuenta desea incursionar en ese rubro.  Es por eso que para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Eidio, 40, is married living with his wife and two children in the town of Joven San Martín in the city of Lambayeque located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Department Capital.  

He works providing transportation services in a mototaxi (motorcycle with an attached cabin used to transport passengers and cargo).  He’s been in this business one year and his main customers are local merchants.  He also earns income working as a butcher (meat providers for markets).  His wife helps out with household expenses working as a day laborer.

Eidio wants to buy more animals to sell as well as feed for them and to repair the corrals because having experience in this line of work he wants to go into it.  To reach his objective, he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 100 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell, cattle feed and to repair the corrals.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Suzette works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Suzette is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Suzette has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Carmen Alfredina

texts.es: Carmen se dedica junto a su esposo a la venta de leche de soya, tienen varios años en el negocio por lo que tiene una excelente clientela. La preparación de la receta la realiza ella ya que no es complicado el proceso pero si es un poco largo. La  soya es una vaina pilosa que crece en grupos de 3-5, cada vaina tiene 3-8 cm de longitud y usualmente contiene 2-4 semillas de 5-11 mm de diámetros la cual se pela y para la venta. La preparación es la siguiente: remojar la soya de un día para otro, luego se desecha el agua y en un tazón se pone la soya remojada, luego se pone a hervir en una olla durante 5 a 10 minutos hasta que este cocinada, se elimina el agua, licua, agregue un litro de agua o un poco mas previamente hervida fría y cierna en un tamiz fino, se vuelve hacer hervir y esta lista la leche. A veces se deja hervir la leche por 5 minutos más añadiéndole esencia de vainilla, azúcar o panela luego se deja enfriar para su envase. Se vende en botellas con varias presentaciones las cuales tienen un costo de venta diferente. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de azúcar, botellas plásticas, soya por quintales. Espera a futuro convertirse en distribuidor de la leche de soya a fin de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen and her husband sell soy milk. They have been in the business for several years, so they have an excellent clientele. 

She is the one who prepares the recipe; the process is not complicated but it is a bit long. 

Soy is a hairy pod that grows in groups of 3-5; each pod is 3-8 cm long, and usually contains 2-4 seeds, 5-11 mm in diameter, which is shelled for sale. 

The preparation is as follows: soak the soybeans overnight; then throw out the water and put the soaked soybeans in a bowl; then boil it in a pot for 5-10 minutes until it is cooked; strain away the water; blend it; add one litre or more of previously boiled cold water; strain it with a fine sieve; bring it to a boil again, and the milk is ready.

Sometimes you leave the milk to boil for five minutes more, adding to it vanilla extract, sugar or unrefined brown sugar; then you leave it to cool for bottling. 

The bottles are sold in several product presentations, which have different prices. 

The loan she is applying for is to buy sugar, plastic bottles, and soybeans by the quintal (50 kg).  She hopes to someday become a distributor of soy milk, with the aim of improving her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sugar, plastic bottles and soybeans.

loans.name: Betty Rosana

texts.es:
Betty tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres, en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el departamento de Lambayeque.
Betty se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores desde hace 2 años.  Los corrales se encuentran ubicados en su propio domicilio y tiene clientela fija, que son básicamente comerciantes del mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa.
Con los ingresos que obtiene de este trabajo le ayuda para cubrir sus gastos y los de su familia.
Betty con el paso del tiempo ha visto que sus corrales se han deteriorado un poco, por lo que desea darles mantenimiento y a la vez acondicionar una parte para la crianza de cerdos, ya que ha adquirido experiencia en la crianza de estos.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Betty, 24, is single living with her parents in the city of Lambayeque located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Department.

Betty works raising small farm animals to sell; she’s been in business two years.  The corrals are located at home and she has a regular clientele who are basically merchants in the market located near her house.   With income earned from this work she’s able to cover her and her family’s expenses.

As time has gone by, Betty has noticed that her corrals have worn down a little so wants to repair them and at the same time set aside some space to set up a pig sty because she’s now acquired some experience raising pigs.  In order to reach her objective she’s deemed it advisable to obtain a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to repair corrals and build a new pig sty.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
César tiene 31 años, es conviviente y es conocido en su zona por su labor de crianza y venta de animales.  Vive con su familia (su conviviente y su hijo), quienes le apoyan en su labor. Su vivienda está ubicada a en el distrito de Cayalti, lugar ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
César y su familia tienen una muy buena reputación, y se caracterizan por ser una familia unida y dedicada a su trabajo.
Los animales que cría para su posterior venta, están ubicados en la parte posterior de su casa, y una vez alcanzado un nivel adecuado, los vende a sus vecinos y/o comerciantes de la zona.

Con el afán de hacer crecer su negocio, ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.  Con esta inversión ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e incrementará su nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
César, 31, has a spouse and is known in his area for his work raising and selling animals.  He lives with his family (spouse and son) who support his efforts.  His house is located in Cayalti District, a place located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque Department.

César and his family have a very good reputation.  They are noted for being a very united family that’s dedicated to their work.  The animals he raises for subsequent sale are located in his back yard and once they reach adequate development he sells them to his neighbors and/or local merchants.

Aiming at making his business grow, he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.  With this loan he will expand his customer base adding new ones and will increase his income level.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Cinthia Vanessa

texts.es:
Cinthia tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos como carga familiar.  Vive en el caserío Juan Velasco Alvarado correspondiente al distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
La actividad que desarrolla Cinthia, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad  en su domicilio donde atiende todos los días de la semana a clientela conocida, cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio. Con los ingresos que percibe solventa sus gastos y los de su familia
Cinthia ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, los que invertirá en compra de mercaderia para surtir bodega y atender a su clientela, esto, le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de los suyos.
texts.en:
Cinthia, 23, is single and has two children in her care.  She lives in the Juan Velasco Alvarado hamlet belonging to Tambogrande District, an agricultural zone with regular commercial movement located in Piura Province over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

The activity Cintia carries out is selling basic staples at home; she’s open every day of the week and takes care of known clientele.  She has more than three years’ experience running her business.  With income earned she covers her and her family’s expenses.

Cinthia has requested a 1000 new sol loan to buy merchandise to stock her store and tend to customers.  This will make it possible for her to continue growing in business and to improve her and her loved ones’ quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staples for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: La señora Rosa, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo y un hijo en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 3 años y medio que doña Rosa estableció su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, ella vende verduras, granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, pan, condimentos, harina, huevos, etc.  Además ella obtiene otros ingresos por venta de nacatamales que hace los fines de semana por encargo. Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo de 20,000 Lempiras para comprar más productos alimenticios y mantener surtido el negocio. Ha obtenido seis préstamos con ODEF con este actual, los que le han ayudado a incrementar las ventas y tener mayor demanda. Su idea es seguir creciendo y tener siempre una fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is married living with her husband and son in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  Three and a half years ago Rosa started her own grocery store where she sells basic staples like vegetables, grains, sugar, lard, bread, condiments, flour, eggs, etc.  She also earns additional income selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] that she makes on weekends to order.

She’s asking for a new 20,000 Lempira loan to buy more foodstuffs to keep her grocery store well-stocked.  She’s gotten six loans counting this one from ODEF which have helped her increase sales and to have more demand.  Her idea is to continue growing and always have a source of income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 43 years old and married with three children.

Teodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,500 loan through NWTF to buy items  like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Teodora has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Teodora aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta, a 51-year-old married mother of five, has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her enterprise. She is now requesting a PHP 29500 loan to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs, and would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is 64 years old and married with five children.

Dativa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Dativa has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from raising pigs, rice milling, and retail of feeds.

Dativa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años de edad, separada, con 2 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia con hijos menores. La comunidad donde vive está ubicada a 30 minutos de Tambogrande y perteneciente al distrito de las Lomas. Esta zona ya cuenta con el servicio básico de luz. 
La actividad que desarrolla María, es la venta de abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas donde reside, y además cuenta con aves de corral. María atiende el negocio todo el día. Se dedica a la venta de pollo, pescado, abarrotes y bebidas hace aproximadamente más de 6 años. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos y los de sus 2 menores hijos.
María solicita un crédito de 2800 nuevos soles para la compra de capital de trabajo para bodega (compra de abarrotes, bebidas, útiles de limpieza, etc). Para eso clienta cuenta con grandes deseos de superación y crecimiento en el negocio. Cliente muy conocida en la zona.
texts.en:
María, 31, is separated and has two dependent children.  She lives in her own house with her minor children.  The community she lives in is located 30 minutes from Tambogrande and belongs to Las Lomas District.  This zone already has electricity.

The activity María carries out is selling groceries, beverages and snacks at home; she also raises barnyard fowl.  María tends to her store all day.  She sells chicken, fish, groceries and beverages and has been in business approximately six years.  With income earned she covers her expenses and those of her two minor children.

María is asking for a 2,800 new sol loan to buy working capital for her store (groceries, beverages, cleaning supplies, etc.).  She very much wants to get ahead and grow in business.  She’s very well-known in the zone.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Luz Edelmira

texts.es:
Luz tiene 67 años de edad, casada y con 01 hija a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Monteverde Bajo correspondiente al  Distrito de Tambogrande. Clienta vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla Luz es la agricultura, conjuntamente con su esposo tiene 3.29 has de terreno agrícola, en donde tienen 3.0 has de mango Edward y Kent, también tienen cacao en producción. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno. Cuentan con más de 20 años de experiencia en la agricultura y ganadería.  Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Luz desea comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de mango, es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Luz, 67, is married and has a daughter in her care.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter.  The house is located in Monteverde Bajo hamlet belonging to Tambogrande District.  She lives in the rural part of the district but does have electricity.

Luz’s activity is agriculture.  She and her husband have 3.29 hectares of farmland where they grow 3 hectares of Edward and Kent mangoes; they are also growing cocoa beans.  In addition, she raises cattle.  They have more than 20 years’ experience in agriculture and animal husbandry.  This activity if their source of family income.  

Luz wants to buy fertilizer for her mango crops and this is why she’s asked for a 2000 new sol loan to reach her objective.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, a 37-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a rice retail business in the Philippines for the past eight years, and also earns income from a general store and pig fattening.

Analyn, who has borrowed and repaid 18 previous loans from NWTF, is now requesting a PHP 25000 loan to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and married with three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 50 years old and has three children.

Luisa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luisa has been pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 58 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maricon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Maricon has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, soap, etc.

In the future, Maricon would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 67 years old and married with eight children.

Remedios works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Remedios has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from dressmaking and raising pigs.

Remedios aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Georges

texts.fr: Mr Georges habite à des kilomètres de l’Institution, âgé de 44 ans, marié et père de famille il est mâcon de profession depuis 10 ans. Il travaille de 8 h à 16 h, pour subvenir aux besoins familiaux il a ouvert une boutique chez lui  qu’il a confié à son cousin ; Mr Georges fait un inventaire tous les 6 mois et gagne 350 000 F et il sollicite un prêt de 300 000 f pour renforcer son fond de commerce et acheter des planches pour le coffrage afin de générer plus de revenus pour faire face aux dépenses familiales. Ce prêt lui permettra de ne plus louer de planches et il rêve un jour d’avoir suffisamment de revenus pour fructifier son commerce et avoir ses propres planches pour les louer aux autres mâcons.
texts.en:
Georges lives miles away from (the microfinance) institution.  He is 44 years old, married, and has a family.  

He has been working as a professional mason for the past ten years.  He works from 8 o'clock in the morning until 4 o'clock in the afternoon.

In order to meet his family's needs, he has also opened a shop, inside his home, which he has entrusted to his cousin.  Georges makes an inventory every 6 months and makes 350,000 francs.

He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to boost his business and to buy some wooden boards which will be used for formwork.  This loan will allow him to increase his income and to cover his family expenses.

Thanks to this loan, he will also be able to stop renting wood.  His dream is to make enough money one day to make his business thrive, and to own his own wood to rent to other masons.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards (formwork wood) to be used on construction sites.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Armando Fabiel

texts.es:
Don Armando, tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de victoria, Yoro.
El ha trabajado la agricultura desde cuando era niño junto a su padre ya tiene 35 años de hacer sus propias fincas de cultivo, actualmente tiene maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en los mercados locales o llegan a comprarle a su casa. También realiza otra actividad, tiene cría de cerdos en este negocio se involucra su familia. El ha solicitado un préstamo de 12,000 Lempiras para mejorar sus cultivos, ya que necesita fertilizar y abonarlos para que su producción sea de calidad y en mayor cantidad. Para él, los préstamos son una gran oportunidad para sacar buenas cosechas y obtener más ganancias. su meta es mejorar los cultivos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Armando, 54, is married and has three children; he lives with his family in the town of Victoria, Yoro.  He’s worked in agriculture since he was a boy alongside his father; he’s now been working on his own farm for 35 years.  He mainly grows beans and corn.  He sells his products in local markets or to buyers who come to his house.  He also has another activity, raising pigs; he involves his family in this activity.

He’s requesting a 12,000 Lempira loan to improve his corps because he needs to fertilize them and to add manure so that crop yields will be larger and better quality.  For him, the loans are a great opportunity to obtain good harvests and earn higher profits.  His goal is to improve the crops to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de María tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 menores hijos en Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de consumo diario, siempre brindando una buena atención, con lo cual siempre se garantiza una buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante a su familia y progresar juntos poco a poco.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral.

Flor de María desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su nivel de venta y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Flor de María is 27 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband and two minor children in Oyotún, a farming area located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic household products and groceries from a small grocery store set up in her home. There she offers her neighbors all kinds of products for daily use, always providing good service, with a warm welcome always guaranteed. 

The income she earns from this activity is used to raise her family and so that they can progress together little by little. At the same time, she raises and sells farmyard animals. 

Flor de María wishes to acquire more merchandise in order to increase her level of sales and earnings. For this reason, she has seen fit to apply to Edpyme  Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her grocery store, such as milk, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Doña Eugenia tiene 44 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula. Hace 5 años que ella decidió establecer su propio negocio de elaboración de tortillas de maíz. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y sus clientes son de la misma comunidad. Con el préstamo que solicita que es por 10,000 Lempiras va comprar los insumos como ser harina de maíz y la leña para elaborar las tortillas para la venta. Este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos. Siendo su meta atender mejor a sus clientes para obtener mejores ingresos y ayudar a su familia económicamente y que su negocio crezca día a día.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 44, is married and has three children.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.  She started her own tortilla business five years ago.  The business is located at home and her customers are from the same community.  

She will use the 10,000 Lempira loan she’s requesting to buy ingredients like corn flour and firewood to make the tortillas to sell.  This loan will help her increase sales and income.  Her goal is to provide better customer service so that she can earn higher income and help her family economically and that her business grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy corn flour and firewood to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Diamantina

texts.es: LA SRA. DIAMANTINA TIENE 69 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA ES VIUDA DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS, VIVE SOLA, YA QUE SUS HIJOS SON MAYORES Y ESTAN CASADOS. ELLA RECIBE UNA PENSION POR MES, LA CUAL NO LE ES SUFICIENTE PARA CUBRIR SUS GASTOS. POR LO CUAL DESDE HACE YA CASI 8 AÑOS DIAMANTINA VENDE ROPA USADA EN UN TIAGUIS DE LA CIUDAD. ELLA TIENE EL DESEO DE HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, YA QUE ES UNA FUENTE DE INGRESOS QUE LE AYUDA A CUBRIR SUS NECESIDADES Y LA MANTIENE ACTIVA Y PRODUCTIVA. ES POR ESTE MOTIVO QUE ELLA COMPARTE SU NECESIDAD Y SOLICITA UN PRESTAMO CON EL CUAL PUEDA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO COMPRANDO MAS MERCANCIA DE ROPA Y ZAPATOS, Y ASI PODER OBTENER UN MEJOR INGRESO.
texts.en: Diamantina is 69 years old. She has been a widow for several years and she lives alone now that her children are older and married. She receives a pension each month which is not sufficient to cover her expenses. Because of this, for nearly the last eight years Diamantina has sold used clothing in the city market. She has the desire to make her business grow, now that it is a source of income that helps her to cover the cost of her necessities and it keeps her active and productive. It is because of this motive that she shared her needs and sought a loan with which she can invest in her business by buying more clothing and shoe merchandise. This way she may obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Dominga De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Dominga es una pequeña comerciante ubicada en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua, ella tiene 37 años de edad.
Su actividad comercial consiste en una pulpería, donde vende una variedad de productos de consumo humano como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz. Entre otros.
Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a vender de forma ambulante de casa en casa productos como pescado, fritos de cerdo y tortillas suaves y tostadas que ella misma producía.
La señora Dominga es una persona esforzada dedicada a su actividad comercial, prueba de esto es que logro ahorrar y con dinero de una liquidación de trabajo de su esposo lograron poner su negocio personal en su comunidad donde les ofrecen a sus clientes además de un servicio, disposición inmediata de alimentos.
Ella es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Dominga’s a small merchant located in the town of San Rafael del Sur, Managua, Nicaragua; she’s 37-years-old.  Her commercial activity consists of a grocery store where she sells a variety of human consumption products like rice, beans, sugar, oil and corn, among others.  She used to sell from door to door such things as fish, fried pork, soft tortillas and tostadas she made herself.

Dominga is a hardworking person who is dedicated to her commercial activity.  Proof of this is that she managed to save and with her husband’s severance pay they managed to open their own business in their community where they offer their customers in addition to a service, immediate food availability.

She’s married and has four children two of whom are school age.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando a negocio de tienda de abarrotes la socian vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y por medio de este negocio poder sacar adelante a sus hijos que ellos sean profesioanles.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar leche, galletas y aceite al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower continues with her grocery store selling basic staple items like rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She’s been in business six years and works from 8am until 10pm.  Her dream is to expand the grocery store and by means of it raise her children so that they can become professionals.  She’s requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, cookies and oil at wholesale.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Geyli Silvet

texts.es:
La señora Geyli es una pequeña comerciante en el municipio de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua, ella tiene 31 años de edad, casada, tiene dos niños, uno de ellos está en edad escolar.

Su actividad comercial consiste en una mercería, donde vende una variedad de productos de consumo humano como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, entre otros.
Antes de tener su actividad comercial ella trabajaba en un  hotel del municipio.
Cuando ella queda en el desempleo, logra descubrir una necesidad de trabajar e invertir en un negocio y ocuparse por cuenta propia para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y de esta forma apoyar a su esposo. 
 Con su plan de inversión pretende ampliar su actividad, y de esta manera mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, esto con el objetivo de brindar mayor calidad en el servicio y disponibilidad de productos en su local de ventas es por eso que solicita un préstamo a CEPRODEL que le ayude a incrementar su inventario.
texts.en:
Geyli is a small merchant in the town of San Rafael del Sur, Managua, Nicaragua.  She’s 31-years-old, married and has two children one of whom in school age.  

She has a general store where she sells human consumption products like rice, beans, sugar, oil and corn, among others.  Before having her sore she used to work in a hotel in town.  When she became unemployed she looked for a way to invest in a business of her own so that she could work for herself to meet basic family needs and help her husband this way.

With her investment plan she intends to expand her activity to improve customer service.  Her goal is to offer better quality service and product availability in her store which is why she’s asking CEPRODEL for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Duo Sumpango Sacatepéquez Group

texts.es:
Dúo Sumpango Sacatepéquez.
Este dúo está integrado por la señora  Emiliana ella es originaria de Sumapango, es casada y tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica a hacer costuras y bordados se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, desde muy temprano empieza a bordar ya que cada mes tiene que sacar una blusa ya terminada con todos los bordados, y también tiene que coser delantales algo que le a costado mucho ya que la máquina que tiene es manual, es por eso que está  solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para bordados, y también para la compra de una máquina eléctrica ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Dúo Sumpango Sacatepéquez.

This duo includes Emiliana who is a Sumapango native and married with two children. She makes a living sewing and embroidering and has done so for many years. 

She starts embroidering very early in the morning as she needs a completed blouse with all of the embroidery every month. She also has to sew aprons, something which has cost her a lot due to her manual sewing machine. For this reason, she is asking for the loan in order to buy raw materials for embroidery and an electric sewing machine which will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy materials for embroidery and an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermín tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposa. La casa está ubicada en la Caserío San Pedrillo perteneciente al  Dist. Tambogrande. Fermín y su familia viven en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla Fermín es la agricultura, para lo cual cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola, en donde tiene mango y limón en producción. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, las cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura y ganadería. Complementariamente es trabajador estable en un fundo agrícola en donde le pagan semanalmente.
Fermín está solicitando un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.  El destino del crédito será para la compra de fertilizantes para sus plantas de mango y limón.
texts.en:
Fermín is 52 years old. He is married, but has no children in his care. He lives with his wife in their own house, which is located in the village of San Pedrillo in the district of Tambogrande. Fermín and his family live in the rural part of the district, but he has electrical service. 

Fermín's work is in agriculture, for which he has one hectare of farmland, where he grows mangos and lemons. To complement this, he raises barnyard fowl, which he sells in the local market when they reach ideal weight and size. He has more than 10 years experience in agriculture and livestock-raising.  

In addition, he is a steady worker at a farm where they pay him weekly. 

Fermín is applying for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles. The loan will be earmarked for the purchase of fertilizers for his mango and lemon plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa para niños,la socia vende polos,casacas y pantalones y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de restauarnt,la socia prepara platos como pollo al horno,saltado de carne y sopas,por medio de estos negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia y tiene 5 años en estos negocios de venta de ropa y restaurant,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el ngeocio de venta de ropa para niños.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,polos y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues her business of selling clothes for children. She sells polo shirts, jackets, and pants, and she also continues working in her restaurant business. She prepares dishes such as roasted chicken, stir-fried meat dishes, and soups. Through these businesses she is raising her children. She has had these business, selling clothing and the restaurant, for five years. Her dream is to expand her business of selling clothing for children. She is applying for this loan to buy pants, polo shirts, and sweaters to sell.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy pants, polo shirts, and sweaters to sell

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario tiene 52 años, es casado y vive con su familia en Cayalti, distrito ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
Mario se dedica a la mecánica desde hace ya 12 años, tiempo que le ha permitido obtener mucha experiencia, la misma que ha sido enseñada a su hijo de 22 años.  Ambos, Mario y su hijo, se apoyan mutuamente en el negocio.
Mario anhela crecer, y en ese afán de lograrlo, ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar insumos y repuestos como soldadura, fierro, pegamentos, etc. Y con ello podrá atender a más clientes y obtener más ingresos con lo que mejorará su nivel de vida.
Mario cuenta con historial crediticio en Edpyme Alternativa, teniendo a la fecha 2 créditos pagados puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mario is 52 years old. He is married, and lives with his family in Cayalti, a district located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque department. 

Mario has been an auto mechanic for 12 years now, which has allowed him to gain a great deal of experience. He has taught his occupation to his 22-year-old son. Both of them, Mario and his son, support one another in the business.

Mario really wants his business to grow. In the desire to achieve it, he has seen fit to obtain a loan of 1000 nuevos soles; money that will allow him to buy supplies and spare parts, such as solder, steel, glues, etc. This way he will be able to serve more customers and earn more income. With this, he will improve his standard of living. 

Mario has a credit history with Edpyme Alternativa; to date having had two loans paid on time.

loans.use: To by material such as solder, steel, glues etc.

loans.name: Jose Marcelino

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere continuar manteniendo la producción en el negocio y poder mantener un trabajo permanente, se comprará harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para la producción de pan, esto le servirá ya que el cuenta con un número de clientes a quienes debe atender diariamente.

Con el préstamo anterior logró obtener buenos resultados, pues su trabajo ha tenido aceptación en los clientes, sus ventas han sido mejores y sus ingresos han cubierto aquellos gastos que son necesarios cubrir en el hogar.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan since he wants to continue the production in his business and to keep a regular job.  He will buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, and other supplies that he needs to bake bread.  This will help since he has a number of customers he serves every day.

The last loan gave him good results since his work has been favored by his customers.  His sales have been better and his investment has covered his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and eggs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling round timber in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 15 years. Helen also earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and renting boarding houses.

Helen is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of round timber to sell in her business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of round timber to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves, 58 years old, is widowed and has 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past year, Nieves has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts for her business. In the future, Nieves would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts for her business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns additional income from selling gasoline and raising livestock. Analiza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gpf Ndiobene Bangadji Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Gpf ndiobene bangadji" est un groupe de solidarité qui compte 18 membres toutes des femmes.Elles exploitent un champs collectif de mil dans leur localité.La vente de la production leur rapporte des revenus qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et à ceux de leurs familles notamment leurs enfants.Le chef de groupe( au milieu, en foulard rouge) est mère d'une famille de cinq enfants dont les deux vont à l'école.Elle vend durant la saison des pluies des fruits et durant la saison sèche des produits agricoles. Le groupement sollicite un pret de 990 000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en:
The group "Gpf ndiobene bangadji" is a unified group made up entirely of women. Together they farm a communal field of millet in their region. The profit they earn from selling their crop allows the women to support both their own basic needs and those of their families, most notably their children.

The captain of the group (in the middle, wearing a red head kerchief) is the mother of a family of five children, two of whom attend school. She sells fruits during the rainy season and agricultural products during the dry season. The group is requesting a loan of 990,000 francs CFA to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old and married with one child.   Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the store for 2 years.  

Victoria requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.  She has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Amalia works hard to support her family.  She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from raising pigs and goats. 

Amalia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell in her business.  Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy bananas to resell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old and married with 9 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Teresita has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from vegetables vending.

Teresita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old and married with 6 children.    Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines.  She has been running her charcoal business for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Elena requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.   Elena has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family.   She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.   In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old, married and has five children who are in school. To earn a living, she does tailoring.  She works in a competitive environment with loyal customers. She has engaged herself in this business for ten years and has employed three people.  In addition, she sells fish to generate more income. 

Ruth's dream is to open more tailoring outlets in a different location in the future. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: buy fabrics for her tailoring business

loans.name: Laine

texts.en:
Laine is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Laine has a small store that sells spices. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of spices to resell.

Laine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy spices to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 54 years old, is married and has 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, Maria has operated a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She also earns an income from raising pigs. Maria has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

Maria has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Haydee works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from renting beach cottages and raising chickens. Haydee is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Haydee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Shela

texts.en: Shela is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 2 children. For the past 5 years, Shela has operated a shop where she makes and sells souvenirs. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy materials used in making souvenirs. Shela is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in making souvenirs

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita, 51 years old, is widowed and has 8 children. For the past 10 years, she has earned a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Angelita also earns additional income from making nipa (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair). She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Angelita works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic, 26 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. To earn a living, he sells fruits in a competitive environment with loyal customers. Dominic has engaged in this business for six years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. Dominic dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet, 25, is married and has three dependent children. She lives in a rental house in the town of Kaloleni. For the past 6 years, Linet has operated a retail business selling coconuts; she’s well-known in the zone and currently has a stable clientele. 

Linet is asking for a 20,000 KES loan to buy more coconuts for sale.  With this investment, she will be able to provide her children with a better quality of life and to move them forward. Linet very much wants to get ahead and to grow as a businesswoman. Her children are her reason to live and she strives for them daily. Nothing would make her happier than to see them become upstanding citizens. She gives thanks in advance for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Tuimizane Group

texts.fr: La cliente, Charlotte, conseillère du groupe de crédit Tuimizane, Femme joviale et dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des souliers au marché urbain de CADECO. Son mari est actuellement chômeur. Elle commença son business vers les années 2000 avec de fonds propres reçu de son mari. Elle fut initiée par ses pairs de lors qu’elle s’installa dans la ville de Goma. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 8eme cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Grâce aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé l’achat de la parcelle. Ainsi, elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 30 paires de souliers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en douceur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Charlotte is an advisor to the credit group Tuimizane; she is a jovial and dynamic woman, an entrepreneur, 33 years old, and mother of 7 children, all of whom attend school. Charlotte sells shoes at the urban market of Cadeco. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Charlotte began her business around the year 2000 with funds contributed by her husband. She was introduced to the business by her peers when she first moved to the city of Goma. The profits from Charlotte's business go to savings, food, and schooling for her children. 

This is Charlotte's 8th loan. Over the time she has been borrowing, Charlotte has seen her business thrive. Thanks to the loan from Hekima, she was able to purchase a plot of land. As a result, she has decided to raise her loan amount for this new loan. 

This new loan will allow Charlotte to purchase 30 pairs of shoes. Additionally, she hopes to see her children grow up enjoying a peaceful childhood. Charlotte thanks Hekima for their efforts bringing self-sufficiency to poor women with meager income.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
