Theresa, 46 years old, is married with two children, aged 27 to 30 years. Her husband is a contractor and all of them stay at Buchanan, only one of the children is in school.  For the past fifteen years, she has been selling lappers (traditional African dress for women) in the market, in order to meet the needs of her children. With the profit, she will buy more goods to improve the business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappers for the business.  Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers for the business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia lives in Buchanan. She is married with three children that are between the ages of 10 and 20. Her husband is a machine operator. Only two of the children live with her, and they are not at school because of lack of financial support. She has been involved in selling used clothing for the past nine years. She sells men trousers, ladies blouses, and ladies skirts. She is proud of her business because, with the profit she buys more goods, and uses some for feeding the family.

She has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old. He lives in the Ganta area and is married with 3 children aged 5 to 15. They all live at home and attend school. For the past 10 years he has been running a general shop. David has requested this loan to purchase more batteries, soap, rice, toothpaste, etc, in order to turn his business into a bigger one. 

The problem he’s faced with is his small amount of capital. He started this business by selling for his oldest brother on a table in the market and learnt how to do this from friends. What he like about this business is that he makes new friends and meets people each and every day; it makes him proud to have money in his home every day. In future he wants to open another shop near the present shop.

loans.use: to purchase more batteries, soap, rice and toothpaste in order to turn his business into a bigger one.

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en:
Bandu lives in the Ganta area. She is 36 years old, and has three children between four and ten years old who are in school and live at home. She stopped her education in the 4th grade. She is married and her husband is a businessman.

For the past five years she has been running a shop where she sells rice in bags. She started this business with money that she received from her husband. One problem she faces is that sometimes there are no customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice in bags to attract her customers. Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rice in bags to attract her customers.

loans.name: Ariel Alexander

texts.es:
ARIEL TIENE 20 AÑOS ES SOLTERO VIVE CON LOS PADRES NO TIENE HIJOS VIVE EN VENTANAS.

ARIEL ES CHOFER PERO EL DINERO NECESITA PARA LA COMPRAR DE ROPA YA QUE SE VA INICIAR EN EL NEGOCIOS DE VENTA DE ROPA EN SU LOCALIDAD EL DINERO LE AYUDADO HA INVERTIR EN EL NEGOCIOS.

ARIEL SUEÑA CON TENER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO Y AYUDAR ASI A LOS PADRES,  EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA PAR TRABAJAR EN UN TAZIS COMO CHOFER.
texts.en:
Ariel is 20 years old, single and living with his parents. He has no children and he lives in Ventanas.

Ariel is a driver, but the loan is needed to buy clothes since he is starting in the business of clothing sales in his area.  The funds have helped him invest in the business.

Ariel dreams of having his own business and thus help his parents. In his spare time he makes a living as a taxi driver.

loans.use: to start in the business of clothing sales

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia atiende su tienda de abarrotes desde las 2:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio de tienda de abarrotes,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para su tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working as a teacher from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.  She also works in a grocery store business where she sells necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She tends her grocery store from 2:00 p.m. until 10:00 p.m. and has had this business for seven years.  Her dream is to expand the business.

The member is requesting the loan to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mirando hacia un Futuro Mejor” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de minimarket, desde hace 12 meses. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa, de lunes a domingo y su horario de trabajo es de 8ºº horas hasta la 21ººhoras, vende de todo lo que su clientela necesite como mercadería y ropa.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará volantines, ropa, azúcar, te, sal, detergente, tallarines, bebidas, verduras, carne, pollo y hamburguesas.
Una de las metas de Cecilia es tener su negocio lleno de mercadería y poner más estantes donde pueda mostrar toda sus productos, lo mas surtido posible para tener  más clientela, para generar mayores ingresos así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Cecilia vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 15 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su negocio grande, surtido y poner otro tipo de maquinas para su mercadería en cecinas, y a nivel personal cuidar y mantener su negocio, ya que anteriormente vendía su mercadería en la calle y logro tener su local en su casa, además pasa más tiempo con su familia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación y confianza. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the “Mirando Hacia un Futuro Mejor” [Looking Towards a Better Future] communal bank in the city of Talca.
She has had a minimarket for 12 months. She says that she works from home Mondays throught Sundays and works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. She sells everything her customers need such as merchandise and clothes. She buys her merchandise in different supermarkets and distributors where she can find it at a low cost, so it works out financially. 

With the loan, she will buy kites, clothes, sugar, tea, salt, detergent, pasta, beverages, produce, meat, chicken and hamburgers. One of Celia's goals is haveing her business full of merchandise and putting in more shelves where she can show all of her products, as stocked as possible to have more customers, generate more income and have a better quality of life. 

Cecilia lives with her husband and her 15 year old son who is in school. Her dreams for work are to have a well stocked, big business and to have the equipment to be able to sell jerky. Her dreams for her personal life are to care for and maintain her business, since previously she sold merchandise as a street vendor and she was able to set up her locale in her house. Also, to have more time with her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it allows her to invest in her business. In regards to the communal bank she is a member of, she remarks that there is good communication and trust there. In addition, the trainings have helped her learn new sales and accounting strategies.

Talca belongs to the Maule region, located in the central zone of the country. It is the administrative, financial and cultural center of the region, and the most important city in the Central Valley of Chile. There is a curious expression for Talca in Chile: "Talca, Paris and London". Among the stories about it are that an English person once said 'Talca looks like London" because of the the aboundant fog that frequently covers the city suring winter, giving it the appearance of the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy kites, clothes, sugar, tea, salt, detergent, pasta, beverages, produce, meat, chicken and hamburgers.

loans.name: Alex Alcivar

texts.es:
ALEX TIENEN 41 AÑOS ES CASADO VIVE CON LA ESPOSA Y CON LOS HIJOS EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS.

ALEX TRABAJA COMO  CHOFER DE UN TAXI, EL DINERO LO VA A INVERTIR EN BIENES PARA SU HOGAR COMO LAVADORA, MICROONDAS CAMAS PARA LOS HIJOS Y ALIMENTO, EL SUEÑO DE ALES ES SEGUIR TRABAJANDO PARA DAR LA EDUCACION A LOS HIJOS Y QUE ELLOS SEAN PROFESIONALES Y CON EL TIEMPO PUEDAN DEFENDERSE SOLOS EN EL TRANSCURSO DE LA VIDA.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A DESCANSAR Y ESTAR CON LA FAMILIA POR QUE EL QUIERE MUCHO A LA ESPOSA QUE SE LLAMA BEATRIZ.
texts.en:
Alex, 41, is married and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas.  Alex works as a taxi driver.

He's going to invest the money in goods for his home such as a washing machine, a microwave oven, beds for the children, and food.

Alex's dream is to continue working to give his children an education so they can be professionals and, in time, get by in life on their own.  In his free time he likes to rest and be with his family because he loves his wife Beatriz a lot.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine, a microwave oven, beds for the children, and food

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, age 35, has been been involved in the sales of fashion "lappers" (traditional cloth) for the past eight years. She lives in the Ganta area with her husband and their three children. The youngest is six years old and the eldest is 17. All three live at home and attend school. Before she started her business, Patricia ran a local "cook shop" (a small restaurant business). 

Patricia has requested a loan in order to purchase more fashion lappers, with the goal of expanding her venture into a larger business. Her primary obstacle is the exchanging of USD to Liberian dollars. 

What Patricia likes about her business is that she makes new friends and meets people each and every day. She is proud to be bringing in a daily income to help sustain her family. 

In future, she hopes to open another shop near the one she now operates.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion "lappers" (traditional cloth) to offer for sale, with the goal of expanding her venture into a larger business

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine, age 40, has been involved in the sale of bagged rice for the past six years. He started this business by selling on a tabletop at the market with a little money that he received from his father. He lives in the Ganta area with his wife, who runs her own business, and their three children. The youngest is 6 years old and the eldest is 13. All three live at home and attend school. 

Augustine's primary obstacle is that his shop needs essential renovations. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more bagged rice to offer for sale and to renovate his shop. 

His goal is to build a house for his family and to secure the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase more bagged rice to offer for sale and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew, age 43, sells shoes and sneakers to earn a living. He runs his shop in the area of Gbarnga. He started the business with the help of a loan from his friend, and he learned this way of selling from his mother. He and his wife have four children between the ages of six and 19, all of whom live at home and attend school.

Matthew's primary obstacle is lack of capital, which he needs to maintain his customer base and to attract new customers. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,00 Liberian Dollars in order to buy larger quantities and varieties of shoes and sneakers to offer for sale. He is confident that this will increase customer traffic to his business. 

Matthew enjoys his work and likes being busy with his business. His dream is to expand his business further, which will allow him to build a house for his family and to secure the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities and varieties of shoes and sneakers to offer for sale

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, age 29, runs a small restaurant business where she cooks food and sells beverages. She has been engaged in this business for the past four years. She is a high school graduate and lives in Gbarnga with her husband, who runs his own business, and their three children. The youngest is five years old and the eldest is 12. All three live at home and attend school.

Cecelia reports that one of her primary obstacles is the high market cost of her customers' favorite beverages. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase these beverages as well as to buy rice and meat to prepare and serve to her customers.

Her goals for the near future are to expand her business and to secure the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to offer for sale, as well as rice and meat to prepare and serve to her customers

loans.name: Kayatu

texts.en:
Kayatu, age 45, repairs and re-sells cooking pots to earn a living. She has been engaged in this work for the past 13 years. She lives in Buchanan with her husband and their five children, who are between the ages of 10 to 25 years old.

Kayatu sold washing soap before she started her business. She enjoys her present work because it produces higher profits, which allows her to better attend to the needs of her family.  

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more pot-mending materials for the business. 

Her plan for the future is to ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for repairing and re-selling cooking pots

loans.name: Mandiaye

texts.fr: Mr Mandiaye âgé de 34 ans habite à quelques mètres de l’agence, marié et père de famille il s’active dans le commerce depuis quelques années.IL  gère l’activité de son frère en amenant un camion frigorifique au Mali avec un chauffeur pour acheter des poissons, son frère lui paie 75 000 f par mois. A chaque voyage il achète pour son propre compte des poissons et parfois des sacs d’oignons qu’il vient revendre au Sénégal et pour chaque voyage il gagne en moyenne 50 000 f ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins familiaux. Mr Mandiaye sollicite un prêt de 200 000 f pour l’achat de poissons qu’il compte revendre au Sénégal. Mr Mandiaye veut un jour avoir son propre véhicule et aller au Mali pour son propre compte.
texts.en:
Mandiaye is 34 years old and lives within a few yards of the agency. He is married and the father of a family, and has been engaged in business for the last few years. He manages his brother's business by bringing a refrigerated truck to Mali with a chauffeur to purchase fish; his brother pays him 75,000 francs CFA per month. 

On each trip Mandiaye also purchases fish for his own business account, and sometimes bags of onions which he comes back to Senegal to resell. Each trip earns him an average of 50,000 francs CFA which allows him to provide for his family's needs.

Mandiaye is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA for purchasing fish which he plans to resell in Senegal. He hopes one day to have his own vehicle and to go to Mali on his own business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 27 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and her husband is a social worker.  They have three children between the ages of 4 and 12 and all of them are attending school and live at home.  For the past 10 years Hannah has been selling used hand bags and clothes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more use hand bags and clothes for her business.  She plans to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used hand bags and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Decontee

texts.en: Decontee is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and has three children ages 2 to 11.  Two are in school and all of them live at home.  For the past three years she has been selling palm oil by the gallon in the local market.  She makes a lot of profit because she sells quality palm oil and has a lot of customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business.  Decontee hopes to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia.  She is married and completed her education up to grade twelve.  She has seven children between the ages of 6 and 18 that live with her at home and attend school.  For the past five years she has been selling rice by the cup in the local market.  She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers and the profit she generates helps her to buy food for her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag.  Comfort plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: Mr Lamine âgé de 32 ans habite à deux pas de l’Agence, célibataire il s’est très tôt lancé dans la couture depuis tout jeune, il a son propre atelier qu’il a loué à 20 000 f par mois.IL sollicite un prêt de 200 000 f pour l’achat de tissus qu’il va confectionner pour ensuite les revendre. Grace à ce prêt il pourra générer plus de revenus et de ce fait il pourra épargner et satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses parents.IL envisage un jour d’être  le propriétaire d’un grand atelier de couture où il sera parmi les meilleurs dans ce domaine.
texts.en: Lamine is 32 years old and lives very close to the branch. He is a single man who began sewing at a very early age and he has his own workshop which he rents for 20,000 francs a month. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy fabrics that he will make up to sell afterwards. Thanks to this loan he will be able to generate more income and thus be able to save money and satisfy his own needs as well as those of his parents. One day he enviseages becoming the owner of a large sewing workshop, where he will be one of the best in his field.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sew them up for display and resell them.

loans.name: Kullah

texts.en:
Kullah, age 24, lives in Buchanan. She is married with two children, ages 6 and 8 months old. The older child is in school. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the initial capital from her husband, Kullah was able to start a business. She has been selling men's jeans, body cream and ladies' jeans for the past nine years. What she likes about her business is the interaction with her customers and the sales that she generates from her business. 

Kullah has requested this loan to purchase more men's jeans, body cream and ladies' jeans for her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more men's jeans, body cream and ladies' jeans for her business.

loans.name: Gpf Darou Mougnaguene Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Gpf darou mougnaguene" se compose de dix neuf femmes.Elles exploitent un champs collectif de mil et d'arachide dont la vente de la production leur rapporte des revenus assez consistants.Elles utilisent ces revenus pour prendre en charge leur propre bénéfices ainsi que ceux de leur famille.Le chef du groupement( à l'extrême gauche, en boubou noir) est mère de quatre enfants.Elle exerce un petit commerce de denrées alimentaire qui lui permet de renforcer ses revenus tirés du champs collectif des femmes.Afin d'augmenter leur production, les membres du GPF sollicitent un pret de 990000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais. Elles ambitionnent de se lancer dans la transformation des produits agricoles.
texts.en: The "GPF Darou Mougnaguene" group is made up of 19 women. They cultivate a collective field of millet and groundnut, and the sale of their crop brings them a fairly consistent income. They use this income to provide for their own needs as well as those of their families. The leader of the group (on the extreme left of the photo in a black boubou) is mother to four children. She has a small grocery business which enables her to boost her income from the collective field. In order to increase their crop, the members of the GPF group are requesting a loan of 990,000 francs to buy seeds and fertilizers. Their ambition is to launch themselves into processing their agricultural produce.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, age 29, is the mother of two children. She lives in Buchanan with her husband, who is a businessman. One of her children stays with her at home, and the other one stays with her aunt. 

Ruth has been selling rice, cooking oil, peppers, onions and other items in her community for the past 15 years. Because of the good interaction with her customers, she makes a lot of profit. With the profit, she buys more goods to improve her sales and help her husband with the expenses of the home.

Ruth is requesting this loan to purchase more cooking oil, peppers, rice and onions for the business in order to meet the demands of her customers. Her future plan is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, peppers, rice and onions for her business.

loans.name: Theresa  F.

texts.en:
Theresa, age 34, has been working hard to manage her mini provisions shop for the past seven years. She is married with four children that stay with her in Buchanan. She started by selling cool water and was taught to sell by her husband. She sells bread, bath soap, hair gel, toothpaste, mayonnaise and other items. With the profit, she buys more goods to improve her business and attend to the needs of her family. 

Theresa is requesting this loan to purchase more hair gel, bread and mayonnaise to extend her business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more hair gel, bread and mayonnaise to extend her business.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between the age of 2 months and 17. Two of them are attending school. 

For the past four years Satta has been selling dried goods (rice, oil, pepper, etc.) in her community market. She has a lot of customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (rice, oil, pepper, etc.) for her business. She plans to send her children to quality schools and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (rice, oil, pepper, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Lucretie

texts.en:
Lucretie lives in West Point. She is 40 years old and stopped her education in second grade. She is married and has five children between 9 and 20. They are in school and live at home.

She started her business selling cold water with an amount that she received from her sister. For the past 19 years, she has been buying and reselling palm oil. Currently she is selling chicken eggs. The problem she is facing is less commodity.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken eggs for her business. She plans to build a shop, build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken eggs for her business.

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mapendo, vice présidente du groupe de crédit Dunda mu Yesu, Femme dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans. Elle est vendeuse de haricots. Elle fait également la coupe couture. Son mari est Enseignant dans une école primaire. Il ya 2 ans qu’elle fait le petit commerce. Plus tard, elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 7eme crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs de haricots. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The customer, Mapendo, who is vice-president of the Dunda mu Yesu loan group, is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 30 years old. She sells beans and also does dressmaking. Her husband is a teacher in a primary school. She has been trading for two years. More recently she was informed about the micro-loans granted by IMF Hékima. She was consequently granted a first loan of $50 to boost her business. The profits from her business are used for savings, as well as for her children's food and schooling. Meanwhile, she has just been granted her seventh loan. During this period, this customer has seen her business prosper. She has thus decided to increase her loan for this new cycle and will use it to buy two sacks of beans. In the future she would like to see her children grow up and buy a piece of land. The customer is grateful to Hekima for its actions to make poor women with low income more autonomous.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of beans.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tewa H.

texts.en:
Tewa lives in Buchanan along with her four children who are between the ages of 15 and 25. Two of her children are in school. She is a widow.

For the past five years, Tewa has been selling slippers in the market. She started this business with a little money that she received from her husband before he died. Since the death of her husband, her business has helped her support her children and herself. She is requesting a loan to buy more slippers for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 2 to 18. Three of them are in school and all live at home.

For the past four years, Annie has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She enjoys the way her customers respond to her business. She learned this way of selling from her mother.  

Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. She plans to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is 46 and lives in West Point with five children between 8 and 23 years old.

For the past 23 years now, she has been operating a restaurant in her community. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a good profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, charcoal and meat for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, charcoal and meat for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 30 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has two children age 7 and 15. Both of them attend school and live at home.

For ten years Rebecca has sold charcoal in the market. Sometimes she has many customers and makes good money. She started this business by selling palm oil, but currently she sells charcoal.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to increase her business. She wants to improve and continue growing her business. She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to increase her business.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "BOK JOM" qui compte cinq membres , toutes des femmes mariées est un groupe de solidarité qui s'active dans l'agriculture.Ces femmes cultivent deux champs collectifs de mil et d'arachide.Elles produisent chaque hivernage une quantité assez importante dont la vente leur rapporte des revenus substantiels.Elles parviennent ainsi à prendre en charge leurs besoins d'habillement, de santé ainsi que certains besoins de leurs enfants.Le chef du groupement (au milieu, en foulard blanc) est mère de tris enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école.Elle vend en saison sèche des cacahuètes et des haricots pour améliorer ses revenus journaliers.Les femmes sollicitent un pret de 850000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais afin de renforcer leur production.
texts.en:
The Bok Jom group, which has five female members who are all married, is a solidarity group involved in agriculture. These women grow millet and peanuts on two shared fields, and during each rainy season they produce a significant amount, the sale of which provides them with substantial income. In this way they can provide for themselves in terms of clothing and healthcare, as well as covering some of their children’s needs.

The head of the group (pictured in the middle in a white headscarf) is a mother of three children, two of whom are at school. During the dry season she sells peanuts and beans to improve her daily income. The group members have requested a loan of 850,000 francs to buy seeds and fertilizers, which they will use to increase their harvest.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gpf Dieuf Dieul Keur Alassane Khodia Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes membres du groupement "Gpf dieuf dieul keur alassane khodia" s'activent toutes dans l'agriculture.Elles exploitent un champs collectif d'arachide mais chacune d'elle dispose aussi de son propre champs de mil et d'oseille.La vente de leur production d'arachide leur permet d'obtenir des revenus qui servent à satisfaire leurs propres besoins ainsi que certains besoins de leurs enfants.Le chef du groupe (au milieu, les deux doigts pointés), est la plus jeune.Elle est célibataire et vend parallèlement des vêtements et des tissus.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 600000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en: The five women members of the "Gpf Dieuf Keur Alassane Khodia" group are all farmers. They farm a collective field of groundnut, but each of them also has their own field of millet and sorrel. The sale of their groundnut crop enables them to earn sufficient income to satisfy their own needs as well as some of their children's needs. The head of the group (in the middle of the photo holding two fingers up) is the youngest. She is single and also sells clothes and fabrics. The group is requesting a loan of 600,000 francs to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mirando hacia un Futuro Mejor” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de puestos varios (kiosko) y amasandería (sopaipillas, tortillas, empanadas de queso, mariscos y pino), desde hace 10 años. Laura se desempeña en sus labores de lunes a lunes desde las 06ºº de la mañana hasta las 24ºº horas de la noche, trabaja en su casa y algunas veces en la feria ya que tiene gente trabajando en sus puestos.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes supermercados, distribuidoras y bodegas donde encuentra la harina a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará masas, harina, aceites, carne, queso, aceitunas.
Una de las metas de Laura en su negocio, son seguir adelante con el negocio, darle trabajo a gente que necesite, gracias al inicio de su negocio pudo comprar una camioneta donde salía a repartir o comprar sus empanadas, compró un terreno donde pudo instalar su local que le ha traído mucha satisfacción en su vida familiar y laboral.
Laura vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 20 años de edad quien se encuentra trabajando. Sus sueños a nivel personal es poder viajar, y a nivel familiar tener una buena vida y salud para la gente que está a su alrededor, y seguir dando trabajo a personas que lo necesiten, y tener la posibilidad de cambiar la camioneta para que la trabaje su hijo en la repartición de empanadas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda y apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Ademas comenta que se siente muy bien con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Laura is part of Mirando hacia un Futuro Mejor Communal Bank in the city of Talca.  For 10 years she has worked in the area of sales stalls (kiosks) and bakeries (sopaipillas; tortillas; and cheese, shellfish, and ground beef and onion empanadas).

Laura works every day from 6 in the morning until 12 midnight.  She works at home and sometimes in the markets because she has people working in her stalls.  She buys her merchandise in various supermarkets, distributors, and shops where she finds flour at low cost, which is economically advantageous.

With the loan she will buy dough, flour, oil, meat, cheese, and olives.

One of Laura's business goals is to get ahead with her business, giving work to people who need it.  Thanks to starting her business she managed to buy a truck with which she goes out to deliver or buy her empanadas.  She bought a plot of land where she installed her place, which has brought great satisfaction to her family life and her working life.

Laura lives with her husband and her 20-year-old son who works.  Her personal dream is to be able to travel.  Her family dream is for those around her to have a good life and be healthy, to continue giving work to those who need it, and to be able to exchange the truck so her daughter can drive it to deliver empanadas.

She is very happy about and grateful for the help and support offered by Fondo Esperanza because it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She also comments that she feels good in the company of the other entrepreneurs of the communal bank group because they share various activities and interests.  With regard to the trainings offered in the meetings, she has learned to better manage her business.

Talca is in the Maule region, located in the central part of the country. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city in the Central Valley of Chile. There is a curious allusion to Talca in Chile, the expression "Talca, Paris, and London." Among the many myths about the matter, some say that it derives from something an English person once said, "Talca looks like London" [Spanish "parece" 'looks like' and "París" 'Paris' sound alike] because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter season, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy dough, flour, oil, meat, cheese, and olives

loans.name: Keamarh

texts.en:
Keamarh lives in West Point. She is 29 years old and has three children between the ages of 5 and 13 years old. 

For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes. Having profit makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. In the future she want to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Femme de 44ans, madame Akoua est mère de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Son mari est employé dans une société. En 2008, elle le jardinage et 04 personnes lui prêtent main forte pour l’avancement de l’activité. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et ce prêt lui servira à acheter des éléments entrant dans le jardinage afin d’avoir un bon rendement et tirer des profits pour assurer le bien – être de la famille.
texts.en: Akoua is a 44-year old woman, who is mother to four children, three of whom go to school. Her husband is a company employee. In 2008 she began gardening, and four people assist her in developing this business. She is on her second loan from WAGES, and this loan will be used to buy equipment for gardening so she can make a good return and draw sufficient profits to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives in West Point. She is 32 years old. She is married and has two children aged 1 and 8. Since 2010, she has been selling soap, body cream and others items in her community. She received a little amount from her oldest brother to start her business and she learned it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, bath soap and many other items for her  business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, bath soap and many other items for her  business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 40 years old and lives in the West Point area. She’s married, and her husband is a businessman. They have three children that live at home and attend school. 

For the past eight years, she has been involved in the sale of palm nuts, sugarcane, cassava, potatoes and potato greens. Her main challenge is the low sales of goods during the rainy season. What she likes about this business is selling to customers, and it makes her proud to send her children to school.

Lucia has requested this loan to purchase more palm nuts, sugarcane, cassava, potatoes and potato greens for her business. In the future, she'd like to be a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more palm nuts, sugarcane, cassava, potatoes and potato greens for her business.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah, 23, is a mother of three children, ranging in age from nine months to six years old. Sabah lives with her friend in West Point. 

She has been selling fresh eggs in the market for the past four years. Sabah learned to sell from her mother. She makes a lot of profit with which she buys more cartons of fresh eggs and supports her children. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more eggs to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fresh eggs to increase her sales

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is the mother of four children. She is 33 years old, married, and lives in West Point. Her children are between the ages of one and 13. Three of  them are in school. 

For the past ten years, she has been selling traditional cloth, called lappers, in the market. One problem she faces is the rainy  season, when sales are low. She learned to do this type of business from her friend. She is proud because, with the profit, she buys more lappers to improve her business and educate her children.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more lappers for the business. Her dream is to give her children a higher level of 
education.

loans.use: to purchase more traditional cloth for her business.

loans.name: Cynthia  P.

texts.en:
Cynthia is a single mother who has been working very hard to meet the needs of her child, who is 13 years of age.

She has had this business for the past six years. She sells body cream, body spray, body powder, makeup for ladies, and many other items. She started first by selling on the open square of the market, but with the profit generated from the business, she now has a suitable place for her business. One difficulty she faces is the rainy season. 

She has requested this loan to purchase more body cream, body spray body powder and makeup for ladies. Her plan for the future is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, body spray, body powder, and makeup for ladies.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina has been in Sootar work for almost five years. She works hard on her weaving everyday so she can earn a living for her family. Currently she has two children, and her husband makes his living as a daily wage earner. There were days when he could not find work and had to return home without any money. His heart was heavy with the burden of facing his family’s disappointed faces. Samina’s children often slept without having had any food. 

When Kashf’s loan officers found Samina in these circumstances, they informed her about micro-finance and the loans they had to offer. The couple decided to take a loan so she could start Sootar work. She said she remembered doing it with her mother in her childhood and was hopeful that the work would help them fight poverty. 

Currently she has borrowed Rs. 30,000 and has used it to purchase material for weaving, like thread, cotton, needles, etc. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf she said her children have never slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own.

loans.use: To purchase material for weaving, like thread, cotton, needles, etc.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 42 years old. She sells used shoes and has been in the business for the past four years. She wants this loan to buy more shoes for resale. She plans to save the profits so she can buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.es:
Jeaneth, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día  pues debe pagar los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para curar su dentadura, pues su dentista le indicó que necesita hacerse un tratamiento para no perder algunas piezas dentales que están en mal estado y  con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para cubrir dichos gastos.
El sueño de Jeaneth es mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is single and does not have children.  She lives in her own house in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz.  She did complete high school.  She currently gets income from working as an employee in a private company for over eight hours a day.  She does this because she needs to pay the food expenses and pay for the basic services.

She needs the loan to fix her teeth.  The dentist told her that she needs to have treatment so that she does not lose some teeth, which are in bad shape.  With the little that she earns, she does not have enough to cover these expenses.

Jeaneth’s dream is to improve her income and to improve her quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan together with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment to avoid later problems.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 42 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and she has five children that live at home. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past five years she has been running a restaurant. One problem she faced is finding a good location.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients like meat, pepper, onions, etc., for her restaurant. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it.

Her plan is to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dorise

texts.en:
Dorise, 33, lives at West Point with her husband and five children. She stopped her education in the sixth grade. Her husband is a contractor. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 14.  

She has been operating a restaurant for the past 20 years. She sells different kinds of food. One of her favorite soups that her customers enjoy is prepared with cassava leaves. Because of the good service that she renders to her customers, she makes a profit every day. With the profit, she buys more ingredients to improve her business and uses some for feeding the family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing lives in West Point along with her three children that are in school.

For the past three years, she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She received a little amount from her husband to start this business, and she learned it from her mother. She like her business because she makes a good profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Muraa Rose

texts.en:
Muraa  is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 12. Three of them go to school.

Muraa  runs a bread making business, and has been in business for 8 years. She has no employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1500 sdg to purchase flour and other ingredients.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In 5 years Muraa would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Muraa says she is happy with the loans given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy flour for making bread.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, in a picture at the hospital where he works.

Leena is a 23-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son. Her husband is a nurse at a local Palestinian hospital. He gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs, so he wants to expand the scope of his work and start nursing to his patients at home.

Leena wants to share with her husband the expenses to start his new project in order to improve the family's income, which will create better living conditions for Leena and her family, so she is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed medical equipment to start his project.

This will offer another source of income to Leena's family, which will enable them to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase medical equipment needed to start nursing to patients at home

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en: Six years ago when Suraya’s son fell ill she thought she would lose him because paying the hospital bills seemed impossible. It was under such tremendous stress that she decided that her husband’s daily wages were too erratic to rely on for any sort of expense. She decided to open a retail shop in a small corner outside her house. This helped her bring a reliable source of income home, pay her utility bills and save enough so her children can go to school. She said if she could reverse time she would force her parents to send her to school so she could be educated enough to work as a clerk. Now her dream is to send both her children to school so eventually they can work in an office and provide for their families in a much better way. She  says that with Kashf’s help and her hard work she will eventually make this possible. She recently borrowed Rs 40,000 and used it to buy dozens of eggs, spices, sweets, biscuits, etc for her retail store.

loans.use: To buy dozens of eggs, spices, sweets, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Rom, a villager from a rural area located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, is a widowed mother of three children. Out of her three children, she needs to support only one daughter who is still in school. Her family survives from her rice cultivation on one hectare of farmland. She has been with this business for 23 years, earning about 14,000 KHR per day. 

She is challenged with the shortage of working capital for growing her rice. Hence, she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. With Kiva partner VisionFund, she and one of her co-members are third loan-cycle clients whereas the remaining member is a sixth loan-cycle client.

She has been able to better support her family, especially in keeping her children in school, from the past loans, which she successfully paid back. Now, as the group leader to apply for a new loan, she will use her loan portion to pay a plowing fee, and some portion of it to buy rice seed plus fertilizer. She hopes to earn a larger income from her current business, so she can keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mirando hacia un Futuro Mejor” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la repostería, desde hace 10 años. Teresa se desempeña en sus labores de repostería de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que trabaja de acuerdo a los pedidos o eventos que tiene que realizar como onces, comidas, almuerzos a pedido.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes supermercados de la zona, a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará una maquina revolvedora (equipos especiales para panadería, cuya función es la de revolver la masa hasta que alcance el nivel deseado para el cliente).
Una de las metas de Teresa en su negocio, son seguir en el rubro y a la vez perfeccionarse aun más, para que su clientela siempre quede satisfecha y la vez seguir generando mayores ingresos para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Teresa vive junto a su hija quien trabaja en una pescadería. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son seguir creciendo y tener una buena salud para disfrutar de su hija y de la vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual le ha servido mucho para integrarse aun mas a su grupo. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the communal bank "Mirando hacia un Futuro Mejor" which belongs to the city of Talca.  She has worked in the bakery business for ten years.  Teresa works Monday thorough Sunday and her schedule depends on her availability, since she works on an order basis or for special events such as parties, lunches or dinners.

She buys her merchandise at the different supermarkets in the area, at low cost, which is economically convenient.  She will use the loan to buy a bread dough mixer to be able to adapt to different customer requirements.

One of Teresa's goals in her business is to continue in this line of work and perfect her skills even further, so her customers are always happy and she can increase her income and lead a better lifestyle.  Teresa lives with her daughter who works at a fish shop..  Her family goals are to continue growing and stay healthy to enjoy being with her daughter and enjoy life.

She is very content and grateful for the opportunity given her by the Fondo Esperanza, since it has enabled her to invest in her business.  And she feels very comfortable with the other members in her communal bank since they share different activities and interests, which has helped her integrate even more in her group.  Regarding the training received at the meetings, she has learned to manage her business better.

Talca belongs to the region of Maule, located in the central part of the country.  It is the administrative, economic and cultural center of the región, and the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There is a curious saying about Talca in Chile, that says "Talca, Paris y Londres".  Among the myths about this, some say it comes from an Englishman who once said "Talca parece Paris" (Talca is like London) because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in winter, like the capital city of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: To buy a bread dough mixer

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is the mother of four children aged between 23 and 3 years. She lives with her family within their rural home where she has practiced mixed farming for ten successive years with income from maize, bananas and beans being among the main sources. She earns additional income from her teaching employment.

Peris has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide milk for the family as well as improve her farming business which she uses to meet major family basic needs like clothing, food and school fees.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loans provision but says the area, though very rich with farming potential, has occasional calamities like flooding and hailstorms.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en: Maylin is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and two children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by buying and selling vegetables in her community. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more vegetables, such as squash and bitter melon, to sell to her customers. Maylin is a new member of HSPFI who hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach, aged 43, is a single woman and a resident of Kandal province's Sa Ang district, Cambodia. From the two hectare area where she plants her rice, she is able to make about 16,000 KHR per day to support her daily basic needs. She has been in this business for twenty years.

This is her third loan cycle with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. After successfully paying back her past loans, she feels empowered that she can sustain her living conditions better than before. Now, forming a group of three female members, Mach is a group leader. She will use her loan portion to purchase fertilizer, rice seed and a portion of it to pay for plowing and harrowing fees. She hopes to produce more rice and sell with a good price, so she can save some money to buy a motorbike to support her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seed and to pay for plowing and harrowing fees

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en:
Sevada is engaged in auto repairing and agricultural businesses. He has re-equipped his own garage to be a workshop and runs his auto repairing business there. Sevada does car seat and body upholstery, car body noise insulation and also repairs plastic details of cars.
 
At the same time, Sevada and his family breed swine, chickens and grow potatoes, maize, onions, string beans, apples and peppers, agricultural products they use for their family’s needs.
 
Thanks to his 2 occupations, Sevada is able to provide for his family.

Sevada is 35 years old. His big family consists of his mother, his wife and three under-aged children: two sons and a daughter. Sevada’s mother works as a teacher at school, his wife stays at home and takes care of their children and helps Sevada in farming.
    
This is Sevada’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a $3,000 loan to buy necessary materials for his auto repairing business (such as sponge, fabric, leather, sheets of rubber, etc.) and also two more pigs and fodder for his pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for his auto repairing business, and also 2 more pigs and fodder for his pigs and chickens

loans.name: Alter

texts.en: Alter, 47 years old, is married and has two children. He lives in Calabayan, Ozamiz City. Alter provides motor transport services in his village, earning a monthly income of 8,000 PHP. Alter has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Alter became a member of GDMPC in 2011. His plan for his and his family's future is to acquire another vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is 40 years old, married, has two children and lives in the Kaloleni district of Coast Province, Kenya. Because he is a responsible father, Shadrack works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his costs and send his children to school. For the last three years, he has worked in his small stationery store. In the rainy season he tends to his farm, growing vegetables on his own land. He is requesting a loan for KSH 30,000 to buy more stationery to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy more stationery to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on plastic utensils for resale.

loans.name: Clara Marisol

texts.es:
Clara Marisol tiene 38 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos de 1 y 11 años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Clara Marisol se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la cría de anamales cómo pollos, cerdos. Las compras y las ventanas lo hace en la ciudad de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ocuparlo en los cultivos comprando urea, semillas, ranger, líquido mata maleza. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá  comprar los abonos sin ninguna dificultad por el dinero.

El sueño es poder comprar terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y estra con los hijos.
texts.en:
Clara Marisol is 38 and married with two children, ages 1 and 11. She lives with her family in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. 

She is a member of the “La Union,” which is located in the Aguas Frias precinct, belonging to the Ventanas canton. The members of this rural bank are short cycle farmers who plant corn, rice, and beans. 

Clara Marisol works in agriculture, planting corn in addition to raising animals such as chickens and pigs. She does her purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. 

She is requesting the loan to use for farming. She will buy fertilizer, seeds, Ranger herbicide, and liquid weed killer. With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase the fertilizer without financial difficulties. 

Her dream is to purchase land. In her free time, she enjoys watching tv and being with her children.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds, Ranger herbicide, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been in farming for ten years in his rural home area in Kisii where he lives with his wife, with whom he had four children who are now all adults. His farming income is mainly generated by sales from maize, bean and banana production. He sells secondhand clothes for additional income

James has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He plans to reinvest his farming income, especially now that he does not have many dependents, to ensure that he secures a better future and old age for himself and his wife.

He says, however, that poor infrastructure has consistently been a major challenge, making supplies significantly costlier especially when they are made to far off markets which offer better prices.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hopkins

texts.en:
Hopkins is a 34-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 to 14 years. He describes himself to be a visionary and determined man.

He operates a tailoring service where he sells skirts, shirts, school uniforms, etc. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located within an ideal business environment and his primary customers are residents within the area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business.

He will use the 35,000 KES loan to buy fabric. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will buy land and a boutique. Hopkins received a loan of 20,000 KES which he repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
 
Emmalinda has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Emmalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Emmalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is a 53-year-old, hardworking, married woman. She lives in Sabirabad with her husband and four children. All of them are adults. Elmira and her husband have been engaged in cattle breeding for more than twenty years. This business is the only source of income for her family. She buys a calf, looks after it for two-three months, and sells it in the local market. This is her first loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. 

Elmira requested a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN to purchase several head of cattle. She will invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase several head of cattle

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a resident from Bohol, Philippines. She has been running a food vending business for fifteen years now. Josie works hard to earn a living so that she can help her husband in supporting the needs of the family.

As of this time, Josie needs more funds for her business' expansion. She is applying for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy additional ingredients such as meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings and others. With this, she will be able to cook more food to sell in her store.
 
Josie has hopes of improving her business in the near future. With it, she can support the schooling of her children, make other investments and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings and others

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal has been working with Posta Kenya for several years now. He is 53, married and has seven children. Together with his wife, Pascal has also been running a business selling ice cream from their home. They have been in this line of work for three years, with his wife mostly running the business when he is working but with him joining her during the evening. His main business challenge is people who do not pay their bills on time. Pascal is requesting a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy polythene bags to use for packing ice cream. He plans to expand this business and hire employees to sell ice cream door to door so that his wife will not have to do it.

loans.use: to buy polythene bags for packing ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel, esta divorciado y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tres ya son independientes, solo vive con el menor que esta en etapa escolar,  viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como técnico mecánico por más de diez horas al día ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación   y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de estuco, ladrillos, pinturas para la  refacción de las paredes de su habitación ya que se encuentran muy deterioradas; también comprará cemento, arena y fierro para el vaciado de una loza de cemento para comenzar a construir otras dos habitaciones y tener mayor comodidad en el futuro.
El sueño de Ezequiel es construir más habitaciones para dar más comodidad a su hijo y con esto mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ezequiel is divorced and has four children three of which are already independent. He only lives with his youngest one who is still school age.  They live in his own, one-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.

At present, he earns income working as a mechanic for more than ten hours per day since he’s the only one who covers food, education and basic utility costs for his family.  He needs the loan to buy stucco, bricks and paint to repair the walls in his house because they are quite deteriorated.  He will also buy cement, sand and iron to lay a cement slab and start to add two more bedrooms for better comfort in the future.

Ezequiel’s dream is to build more rooms to give his son more comfort and have a better quality of life.  This is the second loan request to IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Luis Gabriel

texts.es:
LUIS ES SOLTERO TIENE 21 AÑOS ES SOLTERO NO TIENE HIJOS VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES EN VENTANAS.

LUIS TRABAJA EN UNA ESCUELA ES PROFESOR EL DINERO DEL CREDITO NESECITA PARA EL PAGO DE DEUDAS Y PARA COMPRAR ALIMENTO PARA LA CASA. EL DINERO LE AYUDADO A NO QUEDAR MAL CON LAS PERSONAS QUE LE DAN LAS COSAS A CREDITO.

LUIS SUEÑA CON TENER DINERO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN VEHICULO EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES DE JUSTA HACER DEPORTE Y SALIR CON LOS AMIGOS
texts.en: Luis, 21, is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house in Ventanas.  Luis is a teacher and works in a school.  He needs the loan to pay off debts and to buy food for his house.  The money has helped him to meet his obligations with people who give him things on credit.  Luis dreams with having money to buy a vehicle and in his free time he enjoys playing sports and going out with friends.

loans.use: to pay off debts and to buy food.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is a 37-year-old woman who is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals.  He is a driver. They must comfort their children with all the modern conveniences. The fast development of the modern world makes her children more progressive.

Dilorom tries to provide them with a better quality of life, so that’s why 20 years ago she began her own business sewing national women's dresses. She has her own workshop in the centre of her town. Thanks to the good service, she has managed to gain many customers.

Her elder daughter wants to be married this year but Dilorom’s income is not enough to do her marriage party. She is asking for a loan to buy necessary things for her daughter’s marriage. Please help her to do this to make her daughter happy.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for her daughter’s marriage

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is  51 years old and is engaged in the manicure and pedicure business. She also accepts requests for hair styling and make-up jobs in her community during different occasions.  This has been her business for 30 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy nail polish, a hair blower, scissors, lotion and nippers. Her income will then be used for family daily consumption and school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, hair blower, scissors, lotion and nippers

loans.name: Marlein

texts.en:
Marlein is a 24-year-old married woman who has been working in agriculture for five years. She is a hard worker who helps her husband in making their living for a better future.

Marlein has a very good reputation and is loved by almost all of her friends and neighbors. She applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy iron doors for the barn she has to keep her cows safe and organized.

Marlein is working hard to improve her business through improving the barn situation to help the cows improve their production of milk and dairy products. 

This is her second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing in her paying-back history. Her previous loan was invested in her business, through finishing building the cows' existing room. She will work hard on building another room to increase the number of her cows and that will surely lead to an increase in milk and dairy production.

loans.use: To buy iron doors for their barn

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma lives in Sarnakunk village, Syunik region with her mother and brother. The family is involved in agriculture: they raise cows and sheep, cultivate barley and potatoes. Emma also grows grass in the farm, which she uses as forage for the cattle. Unfortunately, the hay she gathers from her land is not enough to keep and feed the cattle during winter. Thus Emma has applied for this loan to buy more hay. This is important for Emma to feed the cattle properly and maintain a stable development of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for hay

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Anita is buying and selling vegetables. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more vegetables to resell.

Anita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El socio Abelardo pertenece al banco comunal UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO,el socio tiene 46 años de edad ,02 hijos y es casado,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa privada donde el se encarga del area de bebidas y alimentos,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para comprar cemento para la construccion de una parte de su casa.

EL socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Abelardo is a member of the “Unidos Para el Triunfo” (United for Success) communal bank.  He’s 46-years-old, married and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with work at a private firm where he’s in charge of food and beverages.  

He’s been employed for a good amount of time and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He wants to be able to continue working to continue to provide for his family.  He’s a responsible, hardworking person who very much wants to continue to work for his family.


He requests the loan to buy cement to build part of his house.  He is grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his established installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité Joaju esta integrado por 11 mujeres que se dedican a actividades diversas, es un grupo muy joven que se encuentra en su 1er ciclo.
La señora Sonia es manicurista y ya tiene una pequeña clientela formada pero desea aumentar el número de clientes semanales y así aumentar su nivel de ingreso e inclusive poder contratar ayudantes para realizar esta actividad.
Para ello, necesita comprar mayor cantidad de esmaltes y de productos propios de la  manicura, es por ello que solicita el crédito.
texts.en: The “Joaju” committee has 11 female members who carry out a variety of activities; it’s a very young group in its first cycle.  Sonia is a manicurist and has a small clientele formed but wants to increase the number of her weekly customers thus increasing her income level and perhaps even being able to hire assistants to help do the work.  She needs to buy more nail polish and other manicure products which is why she’s requesting the loan.

loans.use: to buy manicure supplies.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami is married and has two children. Both of them are married. Nizami is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to the young families of his children.  Nizami began his own business dealing in animal husbandry when his children were little. He requested a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to increase the number of animals he has for sale. He also has chickens but only for his own consumption though he does relate that if he has any unforeseen need he sells them in the market. Nizami awaits your support.

loans.use: to increase the number of animals

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is aged 50. She is married and they have seven children. All the children attend school. With the loan, she wants to buy more foodstuffs such as potatoes, cassava and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house. She would like to have a booming business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Lorna has a pigpen that sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs.
Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en: Ms Aasia is currently running a stitching school in her house. She lives in Chunian and is known around to be the best stitching teacher in town. She has been in business for 7 years now and says that these seven years have been a blessing. She provides for her four children who are going to school because unlike other children in town their mother is able to pay for their education. While speaking to Kashf’s team, Asia shared that life was not like this before. She along with her husband and children lived in a ramshackle one-room house with the minimum of necessities. Taking a loan of amount Rs. 50,000/- from Kashf helped her account for expenses she thought she could never bear. Her stitching school recently went through expansion. Using the borrowed money she purchased new stitching machines, threads, needles and was able to accommodate two new students increasing the total number of students to 10.

loans.use: To buy new stitching machines, threads, needles etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 10 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas pero no le alcanzaba el dinero para que sus hijos estudien entonces decidió abrir su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas al por mayor.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Valentina belongs to the communal bank Las Leonas de San Jeronimo. The bank is located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca and region of Cusco.

Valentina is 50 years old and has a common law marriage and 10 children. In addition to her daily activities she works in her grocery store business. She sells products of basic necessity such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies. She works from 6am to 10pm.

Previously, Valentina worked raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens, but she did not make enough money to support her children's educations. Thus, she decided to open her grocery store business. 

Valentina's goal is to expand the grocery store. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies in bulk. She is happy for this loan and is committed to making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies in bulk.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,el socio vende tejidos y cermacicos el vende al por mayor repartiendo a las diferentes tiendas que venden artesanias,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negcoio,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negcoio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender la artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar artesania como ceramicos y mantas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: He continues with his business selling crafts.  He sells textiles and ceramics at wholesale distributing to various stores that sell crafts.   He’s been in business 8 years and works from 8am until 5pm.  He wants to get ahead by means of this business.  He wants to have a locale where he can sell the crafts.  He’s requesting a loan to buy crafts like ceramics and blankets.  He’s happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts like ceramics and blankets.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith, 23, is single and lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She lives in the town of Kaloleni and gets along very well with her neighbors.
